Matthew 0:0 <div osisID="Matt" sID="gen1" type="book"/>
Matthew 1:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.1" sID="gen2"/>
Matthew 1:1 <hi type="bold">The</hi> book of the genealogy of <hi type="bold">Jesus Christ</hi>, <transChange>the</transChange> son of David, <transChange>the</transChange> son of Abraham.
Matthew 1:2 Abraham begat Isaac, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob begat Judah and his brethren;
Matthew 1:3 and Judah had Phares and Zara by Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom,
Matthew 1:4 and Esrom begat Aram, and Aram begat Aminadab, and Aminadab begat Naasson, and Naasson begat Salmon,
Matthew 1:5 and Salmon had Booz by Rahab, and Booz had Obed by Ruth,
Matthew 1:6 and Obed begat Jesse, and Jesse begat David the king, and David had Solomon by her <transChange>who had been the wife</transChange> of Uriah.
Matthew 1:7 And Solomon begat Roboam, and Roboam begat Abia,
Matthew 1:8 and Abia begat Asa, and Asa begat Josaphat, and Josaphat begat Joram,
Matthew 1:9 and Joram begat Ozias, and Ozias begat Joatham, and Joatham begat Ahaz, and Ahaz begat Ezechias,
Matthew 1:10 and Ezechias begat Manasses, and Manasses begat Amon,
Matthew 1:11 and Amon begat Josias, and Josias begat Jakim, and Jakim begat Jechonias and his brethren, about <transChange>the time</transChange> of their being carried away to Babylon.
Matthew 1:12 And after the captivity of Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel,
Matthew 1:13 and Salathiel begat Zorobabel, and Zorobabel begat Abiud, and Abiud begat Eliakim, and Eliakim begat Azor,
Matthew 1:14 and Azor begat Sadok, and Sadok begat Achim,
Matthew 1:15 and Achim begat Eliud, and Eliud begat Eleazar, and Eleazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob,
Matthew 1:16 and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born <hi type="bold">Jesus</hi> <transChange>who is</transChange> called <hi type="bold">Christ.</hi>
Matthew 1:17 All the generations therefore from Abraham to David <transChange>are</transChange> fourteen generations: and from David until the captivity of Babylon fourteen generations: and from the Babylonish captivity unto Christ, fourteen generations.
Matthew 1:18 Now the birth of Jesus Christ was in wise: when Mary his mother was promised in marriage to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child by the Holy Ghost:
Matthew 1:19 but Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not willing publicly to expose her, was inclined to break off the contract with her privately;
Matthew 1:20 and when he was thinking on these <transChange>things,</transChange> behold an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, Joseph <transChange>thou</transChange> Son of David, scruple not to take <transChange>unto thee</transChange> Mary thy wife; for that which is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
Matthew 1:21 And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus, for he shall save his people from their sins.
Matthew 1:22 (Now all this came to pass, that it might be fulfilled, which the Lord spake by the prophet, saying,
Matthew 1:23 "Behold a virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and <transChange>they</transChange> shall call his name Emmanuel," which is God with us.)
Matthew 1:24 So Joseph, when he awoke from <transChange>his</transChange> sleep, did as the angel of the Lord directed him, and took home his wife:
Matthew 1:25 and he knew her not, till she brought forth her Son the first-born, and he called his name Jesus. <chapter eID="gen2" osisID="Matt.1"/>
Matthew 2:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.2" sID="gen28"/>
Matthew 2:1 Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea, in the days of king Herod, behold, there came <transChange>certain</transChange> wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
Matthew 2:2 saying, Where is the king of the Jews that is born <transChange>here?</transChange> for we have seen his star in the east and are come to worship Him.
Matthew 2:3 And when Herod the king heard <transChange>it,</transChange> he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him:
Matthew 2:4 and having summoned together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he enquired of them where the Messiah was to be born: and they told him, at Bethlehem in Judea;
Matthew 2:5 for thus it is written by the prophet,
Matthew 2:6 "And thou Bethlehem <transChange>in</transChange> the land of Juda art not the meanest among <transChange>the cities of</transChange> the princes of Juda; for out of thee shall come forth a ruler, that shall feed my people Israel."
Matthew 2:7 Then Herod called the wise men <transChange>to him</transChange> privately, and inquired of them exactly the time of the star's appearing:
Matthew 2:8 and sending them to Bethlehem, he said, Go and make diligent search for the child, and when ye have found <transChange>Him,</transChange> let me know, that I also may come and worship Him.
Matthew 2:9 When they had heard the king, they went: and lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went on before them, till it came and stood over <transChange>the place</transChange> where the child was.
Matthew 2:10 And when they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy;
Matthew 2:11 and coming into the house, they found the child with Mary his mother, and they fell down and worshipped Him: and when they had opened their treasures, they brought Him presents, <transChange>of</transChange> gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
Matthew 2:12 And being warned of God in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back into their own country another way.
Matthew 2:13 And when they were departed, behold an angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Rise and take the child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and continue there, untill I tell thee <transChange>to return:</transChange> for Herod will seek the child to destroy Him.
Matthew 2:14 And he arose and took the child and his mother by night, and went away into Egypt:
Matthew 2:15 and stayed there till the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which the Lord spake by the prophet, saying, " Out of Egypt have I called my Son."
Matthew 2:16 Then Herod, when he saw that he was baffled by the wise-men, was very much enraged; and he sent and slew all the male-children in Bethlehem, and in all its borders, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had exactly inquired of the wise-men.
Matthew 2:17 Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremias the prophet,
Matthew 2:18 saying, In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel bewailing her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.
Matthew 2:19 But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
Matthew 2:20 saying, Arise and take the child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they, that sought the child's life, are dead.
Matthew 2:21 And he arose, and took the child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel:
Matthew 2:22 but when he heard that Archelaus reigned over Judea in the room of Herod his father, he was afraid to go thither; however being warned of God in a dream, he retired into the district of Galilee.
Matthew 2:23 And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene. <chapter eID="gen28" osisID="Matt.2"/>
Matthew 3:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.3" sID="gen52"/>
Matthew 3:1 Now in those days came John the baptist preaching in the desert <transChange>part</transChange> of Judea,
Matthew 3:2 and saying, Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand:
Matthew 3:3 for this is He who was spoken of by Esaias the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the desert, "Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight."
Matthew 3:4 And this John had his clothes of camels hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins, and his food was locusts and wild honey.
Matthew 3:5 Then went, out to him Jerusalem, and all Judea, and all the country about Jordan,
Matthew 3:6 and they were baptized by him in Jordan, confessing their sins.
Matthew 3:7 But when he saw many of the pharisees and sadducees coming to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
Matthew 3:8 Bring forth therefore fruits becoming: penitents: and do not say within your selves,
Matthew 3:9 "We have Abraham <transChange>for our</transChange> father:" for I tell you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children to Abraham.
Matthew 3:10 And now the ax is laid to the root of the trees; every tree therefore, which yieldeth not good fruit, is cut down and cast into the fire.
Matthew 3:11 I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance; but He that cometh after me, is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry: He shall baptize you with the holy Spirit and with fire.
Matthew 3:12 Whose fan is in his hand, and He will thoroughly cleanse his floor, and gather the wheat into his granary, but will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.
Matthew 3:13 Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized by him: but John refused Him, saying,
Matthew 3:14 I have need to be baptized by thee, and comest thou to me?
Matthew 3:15 And Jesus answering said unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Permit <transChange>it</transChange> now; for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness.</q>
Matthew 3:16 Then he permitted Him. And Jesus as soon as He was baptized came up from the water; and behold, the heavens were opened unto Him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and coming upon Him:
Matthew 3:17 and lo, a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. <chapter eID="gen52" osisID="Matt.3"/>
Matthew 4:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.4" sID="gen70"/>
Matthew 4:1 Then was Jesus led by the spirit into the wilderness, to be tempted by the devil:
Matthew 4:2 and when He had fasted forty days and forty nights, at last He was <transChange>very</transChange> hungry.
Matthew 4:3 And the tempter came to Him and said, If thou art the Son of God, command these stones to become bread:
Matthew 4:4 but He answered and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">It is written, "Man shall not live upon bread only, but on whatever proceedeth from the mouth of God."</q>
Matthew 4:5 Then the devil taketh Him into the holy city, and setteth Him on a wing of the temple,
Matthew 4:6 and saith unto Him, If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down; for it is written, He will give his angels charge concerning thee, and they shall bear thee up <transChange>as</transChange> in their hands, least at any time thou shouldst dash thy foot against a stone:
Matthew 4:7 <transChange>but</transChange> Jesus said unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">it is also written, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.</q>
Matthew 4:8 Again the devil taketh Him to a very high mountain, and sheweth Him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;
Matthew 4:9 and saith unto Him, All these <transChange>things</transChange> will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me:
Matthew 4:10 then Jesus saith unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Be gone, Satan; for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God,</q>
Matthew 4:11 and Him only shalt thou serve. Then the devil left Him, and behold angels came and attended Him.
Matthew 4:12 Now when Jesus heard that John was imprisoned, He departed into Galilee:
Matthew 4:13 and leaving Nazareth He came and dwelt in Capernaum a maritime <transChange>town,</transChange> on the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:
Matthew 4:14 that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying, "The land of Zabulon,
Matthew 4:15 and Nephthalim, <transChange>by</transChange> the way of the sea,
Matthew 4:16 about Jordan, Galilee of the gentiles, the people that sat in darkness, saw a great light, and to them, who sat in the region and shadow of death, light is sprung up."
Matthew 4:17 From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.</q>
Matthew 4:18 Now <transChange>as</transChange> Jesus <transChange>was</transChange> walking by the sea of Galilee, <transChange>He</transChange> saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; (for they were fishermen:)
Matthew 4:19 and He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Come with me, and I will make you fishers of men:</q>
Matthew 4:20 and they immediately left their nets, and followed Him.
Matthew 4:21 And going on from thence He saw two other brethren, James <transChange>the son</transChange> of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets;
Matthew 4:22 and He called them <transChange>also;</transChange> and they immediately left the ship, and their father, and followed Him.
Matthew 4:23 And Jesus went through all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom <transChange>of heaven,</transChange> and healing every disease and every malady among the people.
Matthew 4:24 And his fame spread abroad into all Syria; and they brought unto Him all <transChange>their</transChange> sick, that laboured under various diseases and torments; even those who were possessed with devils, and lunatics, and paralytics; and he healed them:
Matthew 4:25 and great multitudes of people followed Him from Galilee, and Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judea, <transChange>yea</transChange> and <transChange>from</transChange> beyond Jordan. <chapter eID="gen70" osisID="Matt.4"/>
Matthew 5:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.5" sID="gen96"/>
Matthew 5:1 And seeing the multitudes He went up to a mountain, and when He was set down, His disciples came to Him,
Matthew 5:2 and He opened his mouth and taught them, saying,
Matthew 5:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> the poor in spirit; for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</q>
Matthew 5:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> they that mourn; for they shall be comforted.</q>
Matthew 5:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> the meek; for they shall inherit the earth.</q>
Matthew 5:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> they that hunger and thirst after righteousness; for they shall be satisfied.</q>
Matthew 5:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> the merciful; for they shall obtain mercy.</q>
Matthew 5:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> the pure in heart; for they shall see God.</q>
Matthew 5:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> the peace-makers; for they shall be called the children of God.</q>
Matthew 5:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> they, who are persecuted for righteousness sake; for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.</q>
Matthew 5:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blessed <transChange>are</transChange> ye when <transChange>men</transChange> shall revile and persecute you, and utter all manner of reproach against you falsly, for my sake:</q>
Matthew 5:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">rejoice and be exceeding glad; for great <transChange>will be</transChange> your reward in heaven: for so they persecuted the prophets, <transChange>that were</transChange> before you.</q>
Matthew 5:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye are the salt of the earth, but if the salt be grown insipid, wherewith shall it be seasoned? it is no longer fit for any thing, but to be thrown out <transChange>of doors,</transChange> and trodden under foot.</q>
Matthew 5:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye are the light of the world: a city, <transChange>that is</transChange> situated on a hill, cannot be hid.</q>
Matthew 5:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Nor do <transChange>men</transChange> light a candle, to put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick: and then it giveth light to all in the house.</q>
Matthew 5:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">So let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your father, who is in heaven.</q>
Matthew 5:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Think not that I am come to abrogate the law, or the prophets: I am not come to abolish, but to compleat <transChange>them:</transChange></q>
Matthew 5:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass <transChange>away,</transChange> not one jot nor one tittle shall pass from the law, till all be compleated.</q>
Matthew 5:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Whosoever therefore shall break one of the left of these commandments, and <transChange>thereby</transChange> teach men so <transChange>to do,</transChange> he shall be esteemed very little in the kingdom of heaven: but whoever shall do as well as teach <transChange>them,</transChange> he shall be accounted great in the kingdom of heaven.</q>
Matthew 5:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For I tell you, that unless your righteousness exceed <transChange>that</transChange> of the scribes and pharisees, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.</q>
Matthew 5:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye have heard, that it was said to the ancients, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever committeth murder, shall be liable to the judgment:</q>
Matthew 5:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but I say unto you, that whosoever is angry with his brother without cause shall be liable to the judgment; and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be obnoxious to the council; but whosoever shall say, "Thou fool," shall be in danger of hell-fire.</q>
Matthew 5:23 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Therefore, if thou bring thine offering to the altar, and there remembrest that thy brother hath any <transChange>complaint</transChange> against thee;</q>
Matthew 5:24 <q marker="" who="Jesus">leave thy gift there before the altar, and go <transChange>and</transChange> first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.</q>
Matthew 5:25 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Be friends with thine adversary quickly, while thou art in the way with him; least the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison:</q>
Matthew 5:26 <q marker="" who="Jesus">verily, I say unto thee, thou shalt not come out from thence, till thou hast paid the <transChange>very</transChange> last farthing.</q>
Matthew 5:27 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye have heard, that it was said to the ancients, Thou shalt not commit adultery:</q>
Matthew 5:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but I tell you, that whosoever looketh on a woman, <transChange>so as</transChange> to lust after her, hath already debauched her in his heart.</q>
Matthew 5:29 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And <transChange>therefore</transChange> if thy right eye cause thee to offend, pluck it out and cast it from thee; for it is better for thee that one part of thee perish, than that thy whole body should be cast into hell:</q>
Matthew 5:30 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and if thy right hand cause thee to offend, cut it off and cast it from thee; for it is better for thee that one of thy limbs should perish, than that thy whole body should be cast into hell.</q>
Matthew 5:31 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And it has been said, whosoever would put away his wife, let him give her a bill of divorce:</q>
Matthew 5:32 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but I say unto you, that whosoever shall put away his wife, except on account of whoredom, tempteth her to commit adultery; and if any <transChange>man</transChange> marry her that is divorced, he committeth adultery.</q>
Matthew 5:33 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Again, ye have heard, that it was said to the ancients, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:</q>
Matthew 5:34 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but I say unto you, swear not at all; neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;</q>
Matthew 5:35 <q marker="" who="Jesus">nor by the earth, for it is his footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King: neither shalt thou swear by thy head,</q>
Matthew 5:36 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for thou canst not make one hair <transChange>of it</transChange> white or black:</q>
Matthew 5:37 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but let your conversation be yea, yea; no, no; for whatever is more than these, cometh from the evil <transChange>one.</transChange></q>
Matthew 5:38 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye have heard, that it has been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:</q>
Matthew 5:39 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but I say unto you, Set not yourselves against him that injures you, but if any <transChange>one</transChange> smite thee on thy right cheek, <transChange>rather</transChange> turn to him the other also:</q>
Matthew 5:40 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and if any <transChange>one</transChange> would go to law with thee, to take away thy coat, let him have thy cloak also, <transChange>rather than strive with him:</transChange></q>
Matthew 5:41 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and if any <transChange>one</transChange> shall force thee one mile, go with him two.</q>
Matthew 5:42 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Give to him that asketh thee, and him, that would borrow of thee, turn not away.</q>
Matthew 5:43 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye have heard, that it has been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy:</q>
Matthew 5:44 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them that abuse you and persecute you;</q>
Matthew 5:45 <q marker="" who="Jesus">that ye may be the children of your heavenly Father; for He causeth his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sendeth rain upon the just and the unjust.</q>
Matthew 5:46 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For if ye love <transChange>only</transChange> them that love you, what reward do ye expect? do not even the publicans the same?</q>
Matthew 5:47 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and if ye embrace your brethren only, what do ye more <transChange>than others?</transChange> do not the publicans so likewise?</q>
Matthew 5:48 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Be ye therefore perfect <transChange>in love and goodness,</transChange> as your Father <transChange>who is</transChange> in heaven is perfect.</q> <chapter eID="gen96" osisID="Matt.5"/>
Matthew 6:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.6" sID="gen145"/>
Matthew 6:1 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be observed by them: otherwise ye <transChange>will</transChange> have no reward from your Father, who is in heaven.</q>
Matthew 6:2 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Therefore when thou dost an alms-<transChange>deed,</transChange> do not proclaim <transChange>it</transChange> abroad, as the hypocrites do, in the synagogues, and in the streets, that they may be applauded by men. Verily I tell you, they have their reward.</q>
Matthew 6:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But when thou givest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doth:</q>
Matthew 6:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">that thine alms may be in secret, and thy Father, who seeth in secret, will himself reward thee openly.</q>
Matthew 6:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And when thou prayest, be not like the hypocrites; for they love to pray in public assemblies, and in the corners of the streets, that they may be taken notice of by men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.</q>
Matthew 6:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father <transChange>who is</transChange> in secret, and thy Father who seeth in secret, will reward thee openly.</q>
Matthew 6:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathens do, for they think they shall be heard for their speaking much:</q>
Matthew 6:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">be not ye therefore like them; for your Father knoweth what ye have need of before ye ask Him.</q>
Matthew 6:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">After this manner therefore pray ye,</q>
Matthew 6:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">"Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name; thy kingdom come; thy will be done, as in heaven <transChange>so</transChange> also upon earth;</q>
Matthew 6:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">give us this day our daily bread;</q>
Matthew 6:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors;</q>
Matthew 6:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil <transChange>one:</transChange> for thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory for ever. Amen."</q>
Matthew 6:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For if ye forgive men their faults, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:</q>
Matthew 6:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but if ye forgive not men their transgressions, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.</q>
Matthew 6:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And when ye fast, be not, like the hypocrites, of a gloomy countenance; for they disfigure their faces, that they may be observed by men to fast: I tell you, they have indeed their reward.</q>
Matthew 6:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head and wash thy face;</q>
Matthew 6:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">that thou mayst not appear unto men to fast, but to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father, who seeth in secret, will reward thee openly.</q>
Matthew 6:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust corrupts, and where thieves break through and steal:</q>
Matthew 6:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:</q>
Matthew 6:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.</q>
Matthew 6:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">The eye is the light of the body: if therefore thine eye be clear, thy whole body will be light;</q>
Matthew 6:23 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but if thine eye be bad, thy whole body will be dark. If therefore the light <transChange>that is</transChange> in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!</q>
Matthew 6:24 <q marker="" who="Jesus">No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or at lest he will be attached to the one, and neglect the other: ye cannot serve God and mammon:</q>
Matthew 6:25 <q marker="" who="Jesus">therefore I say unto you, be not anxious for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not life more than food, and the body than raiment?</q>
Matthew 6:26 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Look at the birds of the air; they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns: and <transChange>yet</transChange> your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are not ye preferable to them?</q>
Matthew 6:27 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And which of you by all his thought can add one cubit to his stature?</q>
Matthew 6:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And why are ye sollicitous about raiment? consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin: and yet I tell you,</q>
Matthew 6:29 <q marker="" who="Jesus">that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.</q>
Matthew 6:30 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Now if God so clothe the grass of the field, which <transChange>is growing</transChange> to-day, and to-morrow is cast into the fire, <transChange>will He</transChange> not much more <transChange>clothe</transChange> you, O ye of little faith?</q>
Matthew 6:31 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Be not therefore anxious, saying, What shall we eat, or what shall we drink, or how shall we be clothed?</q>
Matthew 6:32 <q marker="" who="Jesus">(<transChange>things</transChange> which the heathens are <transChange>so</transChange> inquisitive after) for your heavenly Father knows that ye have need of all these.</q>

Matthew 7:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.7" sID="gen180"/>
Matthew 7:1 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Judge not, that ye be not judged:</q>
Matthew 7:2 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged; and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured back again to you.</q>
Matthew 7:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And why dost thou look at the splinter in thy brother's eye, but takest no notice of the beam in thine own eye?</q>
Matthew 7:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me take the chaff out of thine eye, and behold, <transChange>there is</transChange> a beam in thine own eye?</q>
Matthew 7:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Thou hypocrite, first get the beam out of thine own eye; and then thou wilt see how to take the splinter out of thy brother's eye.</q>
Matthew 7:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Give not <transChange>that which is</transChange> holy unto dogs, nor cast your pearls before swine; least they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you.</q>
Matthew 7:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:</q>
Matthew 7:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for every one, that asketh, receiveth; and he, that seeketh, findeth; and to him, that knocketh, it shall be opened.</q>
Matthew 7:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Is there any man among you, who, if his son ask <transChange>him</transChange> for bread, will give him a stone?</q>

Matthew 7:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">If ye then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give good <transChange>things</transChange> to them that ask Him?</q>

Matthew 7:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">whereas the gate is narrow, and the way troublesome, which leadeth into life, and few there be that find it.</q>
Matthew 7:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheeps clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves.</q>
Matthew 7:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye will know them by their fruits: do <transChange>men</transChange> gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?</q>
Matthew 7:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">so every good tree yieldeth good fruit, but a corrupt tree produces bad fruit:</q>
Matthew 7:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">a good tree cannot produce evil fruit, nor can a corrupt tree bear good fruit:</q>
Matthew 7:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus"><transChange>and</transChange> every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire.</q>
Matthew 7:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">So then by their fruits ye will know them.</q>

Matthew 7:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name, and in thy name have cast out devils, and in thy name have wrought many miracles? and I will then declare unto them,</q>

Matthew 7:25 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and the rain fell <transChange>upon it,</transChange> and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house, and it fell not; for it was founded upon a rock.</q>

Matthew 7:27 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and the rain fell <transChange>upon it,</transChange> and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house, and it fell, and the fall thereof was great.</q>

Matthew 8:1 Now as he came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed Him.

Matthew 8:3 and Jesus stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">I will; be thou cleansed:</q> and immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

Matthew 8:7 and Jesus saith unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">I will come and heal him.</q>
Matthew 8:8 But the centurion answering said, Lord, I am not worthy that Thou shouldst come under my roof, but speak the word, and my servant will be healed:

Matthew 8:29 and they cried out, saying, What <transChange>have</transChange> we to do with Thee, Jesus <transChange>thou</transChange> Son of God? Art Thou come hither to torment us before the time?
Matthew 8:30 Now there was at some distance from them a large herd of swine seeding: and the devils besought Him,

Matthew 9:21 for she said within herself, If I can but touch his garment, I shall be cured.

Matthew 9:26 And the fame of it spread over all the country.

Matthew 9:30 And Jesus strictly charged them, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Do not divulge <transChange>it:</transChange></q> but

Matthew 10:3 Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James <transChange>the son</transChange> of Alpheus, and Lebbeus <transChange>who was</transChange> surnamed Thaddeus;

Matthew 11:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.11" sID="gen327"/>

Matthew 11:2 Now when John heard in prison of the works of Christ,
Matthew 11:3 he sent two of his disciples to ask Him, Art thou He who was to come, or are we to expect another?
Matthew 11:4 And Jesus said to them in answer, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Go and tell John <transChange>the things</transChange> which ye hear and see:</q>
Matthew 11:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">the blind are restored to sight, and the lame walk; the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear; the dead are raised <transChange>to life,</transChange> and the poor have the gospel preached <transChange>to them:</transChange></q>
Matthew 11:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and happy is <transChange>the man</transChange> who shall not be offended <transChange>at any thing</transChange> in me.</q>
Matthew 11:7 And as they departed, Jesus took occasion to say to the people concerning John, <q marker="" who="Jesus">What went ye out into the desert to see? a reed shaken by the wind?</q>

Matthew 11:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But what did ye <transChange>indeed</transChange> go out to see? a prophet? Yes, verily, and <transChange>one</transChange> superior to a prophet.</q>

Matthew 11:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for John came neither eating nor drinking <transChange>as others do,</transChange> and they say, He is beside himself:</q>
Matthew 11:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">the Son of man came eating and drinking <transChange>like other men,</transChange> and they call Him a gluttonous man, and a wine-bibber, <transChange>and</transChange> a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified by her children.</q>
Matthew 11:20 Then began He to upbraid the cities, in which most of his miracles were wrought; because they did not repent.
Matthew 11:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto thee, Chorazin; wo unto thee, Bethsaida: for if the miracles wrought among you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes:</q>
Matthew 11:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">therefore I tell you, it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgement, than for you.</q>

Matthew 12:1 About this time as Jesus passed through the cornfields on the sabbath-day, his disciples being hungry began to pluck the ears of corn, and to eat <transChange>them.</transChange>
Matthew 12:2 And when the pharisees saw <transChange>it</transChange> they said to Him, See, thy disciples are doing what is not lawful <transChange>for them</transChange> to do on the sabbath.
Matthew 12:3 But He replied, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Have ye not read what David did, when he, and his attendants, were hungry? how he went into the house of God,</q>
Matthew 12:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and did eat the shew-bread, which it was not lawful for him to eat, nor those that were with him; but for the priests only? or have ye not read in the law,</q>

Matthew 13:1 Now on the same day, Jesus went out of the house, and sat by the sea-side:
Matthew 13:2 and many people were gathered together to <transChange>bear</transChange> Him, so that He went into a ship and sat down, and all the multitude stood upon the shore; and He spake to them many <transChange>things</transChange> in parables,
Matthew 13:3 saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">"Behold a sower went out to sow;</q>
Matthew 13:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and as he was sowing, some <transChange>seeds</transChange> fell by the way-<transChange>side,</transChange> and the birds came and ate them up:</q>
Matthew 13:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">some fell upon stony <transChange>places,</transChange> where they had not much earth; and they soon sprung up <transChange>indeed,</transChange> because they had no depth of earth;</q>
Matthew 13:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but when the sun rose, they were burnt up, and withered; because they had no root:</q>
Matthew 13:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and others fell among thorns; and the thorns grew up and choked them:</q>
Matthew 13:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but others fell on good ground, and yielded fruit, some an hundred-<transChange>fold,</transChange> some sixty, and some thirty.</q>

Matthew 13:11 And He answered them, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Because it is granted unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not granted:</q>

Matthew 13:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">yet hath he no root in himself, <transChange>and therefore</transChange> is but for a <transChange>short</transChange> season; and when affliction cometh, or persecution on account of the word, he is <transChange>as</transChange> soon disgusted.</q>
Matthew 13:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And he that received the seed among the thorns, is one that <transChange>likewise</transChange> heareth the word; but the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches choketh the word, and <transChange>so</transChange> it becometh unfruitful.</q>

Matthew 13:48 <q marker="" who="Jesus">which, when it was full, they dragged to the shore, and sat down and gathered the good into vessels, and threw out the bad.</q>
Matthew 13:49 <q marker="" who="Jesus">So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and separate the wicked from among the righteous;</q>

Matthew 14:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.14" sID="gen468"/>
Matthew 14:1 At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the fame of Jesus,
Matthew 14:2 and said to his servants, This is John the baptist, he is <transChange>certainly</transChange> risen from the dead, and therefore miraculous things are done by him:
Matthew 14:3 for Herod had apprehended John, and bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife;
Matthew 14:4 for John said to Him, It is not lawful for thee to have her: and he would have put him to death,
Matthew 14:5 but that he was afraid of the people; for they esteemed him as a prophet.
Matthew 14:6 But when Herod's birth-day was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before <transChange>them,</transChange> and pleased Herod, so
Matthew 14:7 that he promised <transChange>her</transChange> with an oath to give her whatever she would ask:
Matthew 14:8 and she, being before instructed by her mother, said, Give me here in a dish the head of John the baptist:
Matthew 14:9 at which the king was distressed, but because of his oath, and of those who sat at table with him, he ordered <transChange>it</transChange> to be given <transChange>her;</transChange>
Matthew 14:10 and he sent and beheaded John in the prison,
Matthew 14:11 and his head was brought in a dish, and given to the young princess, who carried <transChange>it</transChange> to her mother:
Matthew 14:12 and his disciples came and took up the body and buried it, and <transChange>then</transChange> went and told Jesus.
Matthew 14:13 And when Jesus heard <transChange>it,</transChange> He departed from thence in a ship to a solitary place of retirement: but the people hearing <transChange>where He was</transChange> followed Him on foot from the cities:
Matthew 14:14 and when Jesus came out <transChange>of the ship,</transChange> He saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them; and He healed their sick.
Matthew 14:15 Now when it was evening his disciples came to Him and said, <transChange>This</transChange> is a desert place, and <transChange>meal</transChange>-time is now past; dismiss the people, that they may go away to the towns, and buy themselves victuals.
Matthew 14:16 But Jesus said to them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">they have no need to go away, do ye give them <transChange>something</transChange> to eat.</q>
Matthew 14:17 And they said, we have nothing here but five loaves and two fishes:
Matthew 14:18 and He said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">bring them hither to me.</q>
Matthew 14:19 And having ordered the multitudes to sit down upon the grass, and taken the five loaves and the two fishes, He looked up to heaven and blessed <transChange>them;</transChange> and He brake the loaves and gave <transChange>them</transChange> to the disciples, and the disciples to the people: and they did all eat, and were satisfied;
Matthew 14:20 and they took up what was left <transChange>even</transChange> of fragments twelve baskets full.
Matthew 14:21 Now they that had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children.
Matthew 14:22 And presently after Jesus obliged the disciples to get into the ship, and to go before Him to the other side, while He dismissed the multitudes:
Matthew 14:23 and when He had dismissed them, He went up to a hill in private to pray.
Matthew 14:24 And in the evening He was there alone. Now the ship was by this time in the midst of the sea, <transChange>and</transChange> violently tossed by the waves; for the wind was contrary:
Matthew 14:25 but in the fourth watch of the night Jesus came to them walking on the sea:
Matthew 14:26 and when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were affrighted and said, It is an apparition;
Matthew 14:27 and they cried out for fear: but Jesus immediately spake to them, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Take courage, it is I, be not afraid.</q>
Matthew 14:28 Then Peter answered Him and said, Lord, if it be thou, command me to come unto thee upon the waters.
Matthew 14:29 And He said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Come.</q>
Matthew 14:30 And Peter went down from the ship and walked upon the waters to go to Jesus: but seeing the wind boisterous, he was afraid, and beginning to sink cried out, Lord, save me.
Matthew 14:31 And Jesus, immediately stretching forth his hand, laid hold of him, and saith to him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">O <transChange>man</transChange> of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?</q>
Matthew 14:32 So they got into the ship, and the wind ceased.
Matthew 14:33 Then they <transChange>that were</transChange> in the ship came and worshipped Him, saying, Thou art indeed the Son of God.
Matthew 14:34 And they passed over and came into the country of Gennesaret.
Matthew 14:35 And the men of that place getting knowledge of Him, sent into all that country about; and they brought to Him all that were ill;
Matthew 14:36 and intreated Him that they might but touch the border of his garment; and as many as touched <transChange>Him</transChange> were made perfectly well. <chapter eID="gen468" osisID="Matt.14"/>
Matthew 15:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.15" sID="gen505"/>
Matthew 15:1 Then came to Jesus the scribes and pharisees from Jerusalem saying,
Matthew 15:2 Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat.
Matthew 15:3 But He answered and said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">And why do ye transgress the commandment of God for your tradition?</q>
Matthew 15:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For God commanded saying, Honour thy father and <transChange>thy</transChange> mother; and, He that revileth father or mother, let him be put to death:</q>
Matthew 15:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but ye say, If any <transChange>man</transChange> say to <transChange>his</transChange> father or mother, "that which thou mightest be profited by from me is a gift <transChange>to the temple,</transChange>"</q>
Matthew 15:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and <transChange>so</transChange> honour not his father or his mother, <transChange>he shall be free.</transChange> And <transChange>thus</transChange> have ye made void the commandment of God by your tradition.</q>
Matthew 15:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Well did Esaias prophecy concerning you,</q>
Matthew 15:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">saying, This people approach me with their mouth, and honour me with their lips, but their heart is far from me:</q>
Matthew 15:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but in vain do they worship me, teaching for doctrines the injunctions of men.</q>
Matthew 15:10 And He called the multitude to Him, and said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Hear and understand <transChange>it:</transChange></q>
Matthew 15:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">not that which goeth into the mouth defileth the man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this polluteth the man.</q>
Matthew 15:12 Whereupon his disciples came and said to Him, Dost thou know that the pharisees, when they heard this assertion, were offended <transChange>at it?</transChange>
Matthew 15:13 But He answered and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Every plantation which my heavenly Father hath not planted shall be rooted up.</q>
Matthew 15:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Regard them not; <transChange>for</transChange> they are blind guides of the blind: and if the blind lead the blind, both will fall into the ditch.</q>
Matthew 15:15 Then Peter answered, and said unto Him, Explain to us this parable.
Matthew 15:16 And Jesus replied, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Are ye also still void of understanding?</q>
Matthew 15:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Do ye not yet know, that whatever goeth into the mouth passeth to the belly and is discharged downwards?</q>
Matthew 15:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But the things, which proceed out of the mouth, come from the heart, and those defile a man.</q>
Matthew 15:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For out of the heart proceed wicked disputings, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false-witnessings, slanders:</q>
Matthew 15:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">these defile a man, but to eat without washing the hands doth not defile him.</q>
Matthew 15:21 And Jesus went from thence, and retired into the parts adjacent to Tyre and Sidon.
Matthew 15:22 And there came out of those quarters a Canaanitish woman, and cried to Him saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, <transChange>thou</transChange> son of David; for my daughter is grievously tormented by a demon.
Matthew 15:23 But he answered her not a word: and his disciples came and intreated Him, saying, Send her away, for she crieth <transChange>importunately</transChange> after us.
Matthew 15:24 But he answered and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">I am sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.</q>
Matthew 15:25 However, she came and worshipped Him, saying, Lord help me.
Matthew 15:26 But he answered, <q marker="" who="Jesus">It is not fit to take the children's bread and throw it to dogs:</q> and she said, True, Lord;
Matthew 15:27 yet the dogs eat of the crumbs that fall from the table of their masters.
Matthew 15:28 Then Jesus answering, said unto her, <q marker="" who="Jesus">O woman, great <transChange>is</transChange> thy faith: be it <transChange>therefore</transChange> unto thee as thou desirest.</q> And her daughter was cured from that <transChange>very</transChange> hour.
Matthew 15:29 And Jesus departed from thence, and came near to the sea of Galilee; and going up to a mountain He sat down there.
Matthew 15:30 And great multitudes came to Him, having with them <transChange>those that were</transChange> lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others; and laid them at the feet of Jesus, and He healed them.
Matthew 15:31 So that the people wondered when they saw the dumb speaking, the maimed <transChange>become</transChange> sound, the lame walking, and the blind seeing: and they glorified the God of Israel.

Matthew 17:1 And after six days, Jesus taketh Peter, and James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up to a high mountain apart;
Matthew 17:2 and was transfigured before them: and his face shone like the sun, and his raiment became white as the light.
Matthew 17:3 And they saw Moses and Elias talking with Him.
Matthew 17:4 Then Peter said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou pleasest, let us make three tabernacles here, one for Thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
Matthew 17:5 <transChange>And</transChange> as he was speaking, lo a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye Him.
Matthew 17:6 And when the disciples heard <transChange>it,</transChange> they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.
Matthew 17:7 But Jesus came and touched them and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Rise up and be not afraid.</q>
Matthew 17:8 And when they lifted up their eyes, they saw none but Jesus only.
Matthew 17:9 And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Tell the vision to no one, till the Son of man be risen from the dead.</q>

Matthew 17:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But I tell you that Elias is come already, and they knew him not, but did what they pleased to him: and so is the Son of man to suffer by them.</q>
Matthew 17:13 Then the disciples understood that He spake to them of John the baptist.
Matthew 17:14 And when they were come to the multitude, there came to Him a man kneeling down and saying,

Matthew 17:16 And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not heal him.
Matthew 17:17 Then Jesus answered and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">O unbelieving and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I bear with you?</q>

Matthew 18:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but whosoever shall lay a stumbling-block in the way of one of these little <transChange>ones,</transChange> who believe in me, it were better for him that a milstone were hung on his neck, and <transChange>that</transChange> he were thrown into the sea.</q>

Matthew 18:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for the Son of man came <transChange>from thence</transChange> to save that which was lost.</q>

Matthew 19:1 And when Jesus had finished these discourses, He departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judea, beyond Jordan:
Matthew 19:2 and great multitudes followed Him, and there He healed them.
Matthew 19:3 And the pharisees came to Him to ensnare Him, and asked Him, whether it was lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?
Matthew 19:4 And He answered and said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Have ye not read, that He, who made <transChange>them</transChange> at first, made them male and female, and said, For this cause shall a man leave <transChange>his</transChange> father and mother,</q>
Matthew 19:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and be joined to his wife, and they two shall be one flesh:</q>
Matthew 19:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">so that they are no longer two, but one flesh. <transChange>And</transChange> therefore what God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.</q>
Matthew 19:7 They say unto Him, Why then did Moses order a bill of divorce to be given, and <transChange>so</transChange> to put her away?
Matthew 19:8 He answered them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Moses because of your hardheartedness, permitted you to put away your wives; but it was not so from the beginning:</q>
Matthew 19:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and I tell you, that whosoever putteth away his wife, except for whoredom, and marrieth another, committeth adultery; and he that marrieth her <transChange>so</transChange> put away committeth adultery.</q>

He that can receive <transChange>this saying,</transChange> let him receive <transChange>it.</transChange></q>

Matthew 19:15 And when He had laid <transChange>his</transChange> hands on them, he departed thence.

Matthew 19:22 But when the young man heard that, he went away sorrowful; for he had large possessions.

Matthew 19:24 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and again I tell you, It is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.</q>
Matthew 19:25 His disciples, when they heard <transChange>this,</transChange> were exceedingly struck, and said, Who then can be saved?

Matthew 20:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.20" sID="gen669"/>
Matthew 20:1 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For the gospel-kingdom is like the master of a family, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard:</q>
Matthew 20:2 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and agreeing with the men for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard:</q>
Matthew 20:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and going out about the third hour he saw others standing in the market-place doing nothing,</q>
Matthew 20:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and said to them, Go ye also into the vineyard, and what is reasonable I will give you: so they went.</q>
Matthew 20:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And going out again about the sixth and ninth hour he did in like manner.</q>
Matthew 20:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And going out about the eleventh hour, he found others standing without work, and saith to them, Why stand ye here all the day doing nothing?</q>
Matthew 20:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">They say unto him, because no one hath hired us. He saith unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatever is reasonable ye shall receive.</q>
Matthew 20:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Now when evening was come, the owner of the vineyard saith to his steward, Call the work-men and pay them their hire, beginning from the last even to the first.</q>
Matthew 20:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And when those came who <transChange>were hired</transChange> about the eleventh hour, they received every one a penny:</q>
Matthew 20:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but when the first came, they thought that they should receive more; and they also received every one a penny.</q>
Matthew 20:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And after they had received <transChange>it</transChange> they murmured against the master of the house,</q>
Matthew 20:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">saying, These last have worked <transChange>but</transChange> one hour, and thou hast made them equal to us, who have borne the burthen and heat of the day.</q>
Matthew 20:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But he answered, and said to one of them, Friend, I do thee no wrong; didst not thou agree with me for a penny?</q>
Matthew 20:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Take <transChange>what is</transChange> thine, and be gone: it is my pleasure to give to this last as <transChange>I do</transChange> to thee;</q>
Matthew 20:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and may I not do what I will with my own?</q>
Matthew 20:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Is thine eye evil because I am good? Thus the last shall be first, and the first last; for there are many called, but few chosen.</q>
Matthew 20:17 And as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, He took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them, Behold we are going up to Jerusalem,

Matthew 20:21 And He said unto her, <q marker="" who="Jesus">What dost thou desire?</q> She saith unto Him, Grant that these my two sons may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on the left in thy kingdom.
Matthew 20:22 But Jesus answered and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye know not what ye ask: are ye able to drink of the cup which I am going to drink <transChange>of,</transChange> and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?</q>
Matthew 20:23 They replied, We are able. And He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye shall indeed drink of my cup, and shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with; but to sit on my right hand and on my left is not mine to give, but <transChange>to those</transChange> for whom it is prepared by my Father.</q>
Matthew 20:24 And when the <transChange>other</transChange> ten heard <transChange>it,</transChange> they were provoked at the two brethren:
Matthew 20:25 but Jesus called them to <transChange>Him</transChange> and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye know that the princes of the gentiles lord it over them, and their great <transChange>men</transChange> exercise authority upon them:</q>
Matthew 20:26 <q marker="" who="Jesus">it shall not be so among you; but whosoever would be great among you, let him be your minister, and whoever would be chief among you,</q>
Matthew 20:27 <q marker="" who="Jesus">let him be your servant:</q>
Matthew 20:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">as the Son of man came not to be ministred unto, but to minister and to give his life a ransom for many.</q>
Matthew 20:29 And as they were going from Jericho, a great multitude followed Him:
Matthew 20:30 and behold, two blind men siting by the way-<transChange>side,</transChange> when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, <transChange>thou</transChange> son of David.
Matthew 20:31 And the people rebuked them, that they might hold their peace: but they cried out the more, saying, Have mercy on us, O Lord, <transChange>thou</transChange> son of David.

Matthew 21:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.21" sID="gen704"/>
Matthew 21:1 And when they drew nigh to Jerusalem and were come to Bethphage at the mount of Olives, Jesus sent two <transChange>of his</transChange> disciples,
Matthew 21:2 saying unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Go into the village over-against you, and ye will find directly an ass tied and a colt with her: loose <transChange>them</transChange> and bring them to me:</q>
Matthew 21:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and if any <transChange>one</transChange> say any <transChange>thing</transChange> to you, tell <transChange>him</transChange> the Lord hath need of them, and he will immediately send them.</q>
Matthew 21:4 Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet saying, Tell ye the daughter of Sion,
Matthew 21:5 behold, thy king cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, even a colt the fole of an ass.
Matthew 21:6 And the disciples went, and did as Jesus ordered them,
Matthew 21:7 and brought the ass and the colt, and threw their clothes over them, and set <transChange>Him</transChange> upon them.
Matthew 21:8 And great numbers spread their garments in the way, and others cut <transChange>off</transChange> boughs from the trees, and strewed them in the way:
Matthew 21:9 and the multitudes, that went before and that followed, cried saying, Hosanna to the Son of David: blessed <transChange>be</transChange> He that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.
Matthew 21:10 And when He came into Jerusalem, all the city was in a commotion, saying, Who is this?
Matthew 21:11 And the people answered, This is Jesus the prophet, from Nazareth in Galilee.
Matthew 21:12 And Jesus went into the temple of God, and drove out all that were selling and buying in <transChange>the court of</transChange> the temple, and threw down the tables of the money-changers, and the seats of them that sold doves:
Matthew 21:13 and said to them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">It is written, "My house shall be called the house of prayer," but ye have made it a den of thieves.</q>
Matthew 21:14 And there came to Him in the temple <transChange>both</transChange> blind and lame, and He healed them:
Matthew 21:15 but when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonders that He wrought, and the children crying out in the temple, Hosanna to the Son of David, they were vexed to the heart, and said to Him, Dost thou hear what these say?
Matthew 21:16 And Jesus saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Yes, have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast procured praise?</q>
Matthew 21:17 And He left them and went out of the city to Bethany and lodged there.
Matthew 21:18 Now in the morning as He was returning to the city, He was hungry;
Matthew 21:19 and seeing a fig-tree by the way, He went <transChange>up</transChange> to it, and finding nothing upon it but leaves, He saith to it, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Let no fruit ever hereafter grow out of thee:</q> and the fig-tree withered immediately.
Matthew 21:20 And the disciples seeing <transChange>it</transChange> were amazed and said, How suddenly is the fig-tree withered!
Matthew 21:21 but Jesus answering said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell you, if ye have faith and doubt not, ye shall not only <transChange>be able to</transChange> do this to a fig-tree, but also if ye shall say to this mountain, "Be thou removed and cast into the sea," it shall be done.</q>
Matthew 21:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And all <transChange>things</transChange> whatsoever ye ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.</q>
Matthew 21:23 And when He was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to Him as He was teaching, and said, By what authority dost thou these <transChange>things,</transChange> and who gave thee this authority?
Matthew 21:24 but Jesus answered them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">I also will ask you one question, which if ye tell me, I will likewise tell you by what authority I do these <transChange>things.</transChange></q>
Matthew 21:25 <q marker="" who="Jesus">The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men? And they reasoned with themselves saying, If we say, from heaven, He will reply, Why then did ye not believe him?</q>
Matthew 21:26 But if we say, of men, we fear the people, for <transChange>they</transChange> all esteem John as a prophet.
Matthew 21:27 And <transChange>therefore</transChange> in answer to Jesus, they said, We do not know: and He said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Neither do I tell you, by what authority I do these <transChange>things.</transChange></q>
Matthew 21:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But what think ye <transChange>of this</transChange>? <transChange>There was</transChange> a man had two sons, and he came to the first and said, Son, go, work to day in my vineyard:</q>
Matthew 21:29 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and he answered I will not; but afterwards repenting, he went.</q>
Matthew 21:30 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And coming to the second, he spake in like manner: and he answered, Yes, Sir; and went not.</q>

Matthew 21:33 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Hear another parable, There was a certain man, a master of a family, that planted a vineyard, and made a fence about it, and put a wine-press in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and travelled abroad.</q>
Matthew 21:34 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And when the fruit-season drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, to receive the fruits of it:</q>
Matthew 21:35 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and the husbandmen took his servants and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.</q>
Matthew 21:36 <q marker="" who="Jesus"><transChange>And</transChange> he sent again other servants more than the first: and they did the like to them.</q>
Matthew 21:37 <q marker="" who="Jesus">At last he sent unto them his Son, saying, They will reverence my Son.</q>
Matthew 21:38 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But when the husbandmen saw the Son, they said among themselves, This is the heir, come, let us kill him, and seize on his inheritance:</q>
Matthew 21:39 <q marker="" who="Jesus">so they took him and cast him out of the vineyard and slew him.</q>
Matthew 21:40 <q marker="" who="Jesus">When therefore the lord of the vineyard cometh, what will he do to those husbandmen?</q>
Matthew 21:41 They answer, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out the vineyard to other husbandmen, who will render him the fruits in their seasons.
Matthew 21:42 <transChange>Then</transChange> saith Jesus to them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Did ye never read in the scriptures, "The stone which the builders refused, is made the head of the corner: this is the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?"</q>

Matthew 21:44 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And he that stumbleth at this stone shall be bruised, but on whomsoever it falls, it will crush him to pieces.</q>

Matthew 22:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.22" sID="gen751"/>
Matthew 22:1 And Jesus resuming his discourse spake unto them again in parables,
Matthew 22:2 <q marker="" who="Jesus">saying, The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king, who made a wedding-<transChange>feast</transChange> for his son;</q>
Matthew 22:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and sent his servants to call those that were invited to the wedding: and they would not come.</q>
Matthew 22:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Then he sent other servants, saying, Tell them that are invited, I have prepared my dinner, my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all <transChange>things are</transChange> ready; come to the wedding.</q>
Matthew 22:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But they slighted <transChange>him,</transChange> and went away, one to his field and another to his merchandize:</q>
Matthew 22:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and others seized his servants, and shamefully abused <transChange>them,</transChange> and slew <transChange>them.</transChange></q>
Matthew 22:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And when the king heard <transChange>of it,</transChange> he was <transChange>highly</transChange> provoked, and sent his troops, and destroyed those murderers, and burnt their city.</q>
Matthew 22:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Then saith he to his servants, The feast is ready, but they that were invited were not worthy <transChange>of it:</transChange></q>
Matthew 22:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">go therefore into the public streets, and as many as ye meet with invite to the wedding.</q>
Matthew 22:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And those servants went out into the <transChange>high</transChange>-ways, and brought in all they met with, both bad and good: and the wedding was filled with guests.</q>
Matthew 22:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But when the king came in to look at the guests, he saw there a man that had not put on a wedding-garment, and saith to him,</q>
Matthew 22:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Friend, how camest thou in here without a wedding-garment? and he was struck speechless.</q>
Matthew 22:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Then said the king to his attendants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him up, and throw him out into the darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of the teeth:</q>
Matthew 22:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for there are many called, but few approved.</q>
Matthew 22:15 Then the pharisees went and consulted how they might insnare Him in <transChange>his</transChange> discourse.
Matthew 22:16 And they send to Him their disciples <transChange>along</transChange> with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art a man of truth, and teachest the way of God in truth, neither carest for any man; for thou regardest not the person of men: Tell us therefore what thou thinkest,

Matthew 22:18 But Jesus knew their malice, and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Why do ye tempt me, ye hypocrites?</q>
Matthew 22:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Shew me the tribute-money.</q> And they brought Him a <transChange>Roman</transChange> Penny.
Matthew 22:20 And He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Whose image and inscription <transChange>is</transChange> this?</q>
Matthew 22:21 They answered, Cesar's. Then saith He unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Render therefore to Cesar the things that are Cesar's; and to God the things that are God's.</q>
Matthew 22:22 And when they heard <transChange>this,</transChange> they marvelled, and left Him and went away.
Matthew 22:23 On the same day came the sadducees to Him, who say there is no resurrection,
Matthew 22:24 and asked Him, saying, Master, Moses said, If any <transChange>man</transChange> die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up seed unto his brother.
Matthew 22:25 Now there were with us seven brothers, and the first married and died, and having no issue left his wife to his brother;
Matthew 22:26 likewise the second also, and the third, even to seven;
Matthew 22:27 and last of all the woman died also;
Matthew 22:28 therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven? for they all had her.
Matthew 22:29 But Jesus answered them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye are mistaken, not knowing the scriptures nor the power of God:</q>
Matthew 22:30 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage; but are as the angels of God in heaven.</q>
Matthew 22:31 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read what is spoken to you by God,</q>
Matthew 22:32 <q marker="" who="Jesus">saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.</q>
Matthew 22:33 And when the people heard this, they were astonished at his doctrine.
Matthew 22:34 But when the pharisees heard that He had silenced the sadducees,
Matthew 22:35 they gathered together again, and one of them, an interpreter of the law, propounded a question, to try Him,
Matthew 22:36 and said, Master, which is the greatest commandment in the law?
Matthew 22:37 And Jesus said unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind: this is the first and great command.</q>
Matthew 22:38 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And the second is like it,</q>
Matthew 22:39 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.</q>
Matthew 22:40 <q marker="" who="Jesus">On these two precepts depend all the law and the prophets.</q>
Matthew 22:41 Now while the pharisees were <transChange>thus</transChange> gathered together, Jesus asked them,
Matthew 22:42 saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">What think ye of the Messiah? whose son is He?</q> They say unto Him, David's.
Matthew 22:43 He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">How then does David by inspiration call Him Lord,</q>
Matthew 22:44 <q marker="" who="Jesus">saying, The Lord said unto my Lord, "Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool?"</q>
Matthew 22:45 <q marker="" who="Jesus">therefore if David call Him Lord, how is He his son?</q>
Matthew 22:46 And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor did any dare, from that day, to ask Him any more <transChange>such questions.</transChange> <chapter eID="gen751" osisID="Matt.22"/>
Matthew 23:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.23" sID="gen798"/>
Matthew 23:1 Then spake Jesus to the people and to his disciples, saying,
Matthew 23:2 <q marker="" who="Jesus">The scribes and pharisees sit in the seat of Moses:</q>
Matthew 23:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">observe therefore and do all <transChange>things</transChange> whatsoever they tell you to observe; but do not ye according to their works, for they say and do not:</q>
Matthew 23:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for they bind grievous and intolerable burthens, and impose them upon men; but they <transChange>themselves</transChange> will not put a finger to them:</q>
Matthew 23:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but they do all their works to be seen by men; they make their phylacteries broad, and enlarge the fringes of their garments,</q>
Matthew 23:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and love the uppermost places at feasts,</q>
Matthew 23:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and the chief seats in the synagogues, and salutations in public assemblies, and to be called by men Rabbi, Rabbi.</q>
Matthew 23:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But be not ye called Rabbi; for one is your instructor <transChange>even</transChange> Christ, and ye are all brethren.</q>
Matthew 23:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Neither call <transChange>any man</transChange> upon earth Father; for one is your Father, <transChange>who is</transChange> in heaven:</q>
Matthew 23:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">neither be ye called masters; for one is your master, even Christ.</q>
Matthew 23:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But let him that is greatest among you be your minister: and whosoever will exalt himself shall be abased,</q>
Matthew 23:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and whosoever will humble himself shall be exalted.</q>
Matthew 23:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But wo unto you scribes and pharisees, hypocrites, who shut up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go in yourselves, nor suffer those that are entering to go in.</q>
Matthew 23:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto you scribes and pharisees, hypocrites; for ye devour widows houses, and for a cover make long prayers: therefore ye shall receive the heavier judgement.</q>
Matthew 23:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto you scribes and pharisees, hypocrites: for ye compass sea and land to make a proselyte, and when he is gained, ye make him more the child of hell than yourselves.</q>
Matthew 23:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto you, <transChange>ye</transChange> blind guides, who say, If any <transChange>one</transChange> swear by the temple, it is nothing;</q>
Matthew 23:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but if any <transChange>man</transChange> swear by the gold of the temple, <transChange>the oath</transChange> is binding. Foolish and blind <transChange>creatures!</transChange> for which is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold?</q>
Matthew 23:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And, If any <transChange>one</transChange> swear by the altar, it is nothing; but if any one swear by the gift upon it, he is bound.</q>
Matthew 23:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">O foolish and blind! for which is greater, the gift, or the altar which sanctifieth the gift?</q>
Matthew 23:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">He then, that sweareth by the altar, sweareth by it and by all <transChange>things</transChange> upon it:</q>
Matthew 23:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and he, that sweareth by the temple, sweareth by it, and by Him that dwelleth in it:</q>
Matthew 23:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and he, that sweareth by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by Him that sitteth upon it.</q>
Matthew 23:23 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto you scribes and pharisees, hypocrites, who tithe <transChange>even your</transChange> mint, and anise, and cummin, but neglect the weightier matters of the law, judgement, mercy, and fidelity: these ye ought <transChange>undoubtedly</transChange> to practise, and not to omit the others.</q>
Matthew 23:24 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Blind guides, who strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel!</q>
Matthew 23:25 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto you scribes and pharisees, hypocrites; for ye clean the outside of the cup and of the dish, but within they are full of rapine and intemperance:</q>
Matthew 23:26 <q marker="" who="Jesus">thou blind pharisee, cleanse first the inside of the cup and of the dish, that the outside of them may be also clean.</q>
Matthew 23:27 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto you scribes and pharisees, hypocrites; who are like whited sepulchres, which indeed appear beautiful without, but within are full of the bones of the dead, and all <transChange>manner of</transChange> filthiness;</q>
Matthew 23:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">so do ye likewise outwardly appear to men <transChange>to be</transChange> righteous, but within are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.</q>
Matthew 23:29 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Wo unto you scribes and pharisees, hypocrites; who build the tombs of the prophets, and adorn the monuments of the just,</q>
Matthew 23:30 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been concerned with them in <transChange>shedding</transChange> the blood of the prophets:</q>
Matthew 23:31 <q marker="" who="Jesus">so that ye are witnesses yourselves, that ye are the children of those who killed the prophets:</q>
Matthew 23:32 <q marker="" who="Jesus">fill up then the measure of your fathers, ye serpents, ye brood of vipers:</q>
Matthew 23:33 <q marker="" who="Jesus">how can ye escape the damnation of hell?</q>
Matthew 23:34 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For behold I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes; and <transChange>some</transChange> of them ye will kill and crucify, and <transChange>some</transChange> of them ye will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute them from city to city:</q>
Matthew 23:35 <q marker="" who="Jesus">that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel, to the blood of Zacharias the son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.</q>
Matthew 23:36 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell you, all these <transChange>things</transChange> shall come upon this generation.</q>
Matthew 23:37 <q marker="" who="Jesus">O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, thou that killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under <transChange>her</transChange> wings, and ye would not!</q>
