Matthew 24:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.24" sID="gen838"/>
Matthew 24:1 And as Jesus went out, and was departing from the temple, his disciples came to observe to Him the <transChange>magnificent</transChange> buildings.
Matthew 24:2 But Jesus said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Do ye see all these <transChange>things?</transChange> Verily I tell you, there shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be demolished.</q>
Matthew 24:3 And when He was got to the mount of olives, the disciples came to Him in private and said, Tell us when these <transChange>things</transChange> shall be, and what <transChange>shall be</transChange> the sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world.
Matthew 24:4 And Jesus answered them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">See that no one deceive you:</q>
Matthew 24:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for many shall come in my name saying, I am the Christ, and shall deceive many.</q>
Matthew 24:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And ye shall hear of wars and rumors of wars, <transChange>but</transChange> be not troubled; for all these must <transChange>indeed</transChange> come to pass, but the end is not yet.</q>
Matthew 24:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes in several places:</q>
Matthew 24:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">all which are but the beginning of sorrows.</q>
Matthew 24:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Then shall they afflict you, and kill you; and ye shall be hated by all nations for my name:</q>
Matthew 24:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and then will many take offense, and betray one another, and hate one another: and many false prophets will rise up and deceive many:</q>
Matthew 24:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and because iniquity shall abound,</q>
Matthew 24:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">the love of many will grow cold.</q>
Matthew 24:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But he that endures to the end, shall be saved:</q>
Matthew 24:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and this gospel of the kingdom <transChange>of heaven</transChange> shall be preached in all the world, for a testimony to all the nations; and then shall the end come.</q>
Matthew 24:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">When therefore ye shall see the desolating abomination, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing at the holy place,</q> (let him, that readeth, attend) <q marker="" who="Jesus">then let those in Judea flee to the mountains:</q>
Matthew 24:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">let not him that is at the top of the house come down <transChange>into it,</transChange></q>
Matthew 24:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">to take any thing out of his house;</q>
Matthew 24:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">nor let him <transChange>that is</transChange> in the field return back to take his clothes.</q>
Matthew 24:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But wo to them that are with child, and to them that give suck, in those days.</q>
Matthew 24:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Pray that your flight be not in the winter, nor on the sabbath:</q>
Matthew 24:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for there shall be then great affliction, such as has not been from the beginning of the world unto this time, no, nor ever shall be.</q>
Matthew 24:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And unless those days be shortened, no one would be saved; but for the sake of the elect those days shall be shortened.</q>
Matthew 24:23 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Then if any shall say to you, Behold here is the Messiah, or there; believe <transChange>it</transChange> not:</q>
Matthew 24:24 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for there shall rise up false Christs, and false prophets, who shall shew great signs and prodigies, so as to deceive, if possible, even the elect.</q>
Matthew 24:25 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Lo, I have told you before-hand: <transChange>and</transChange> therefore if they say to you,</q>
Matthew 24:26 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Behold, he is in the desert, go not out: behold, <transChange>he is</transChange> the secret chambers, believe <transChange>them</transChange> not:</q>
Matthew 24:27 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for as the lightning cometh from the east, and flashes <transChange>in an instant</transChange> even to the west, so shall be the coming of the Son of man.</q>
Matthew 24:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.</q>
Matthew 24:29 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And immediately after the affliction of those days, the fun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give it's light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:</q>
Matthew 24:30 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven, and then shall all the tribes of the land mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming <transChange>as</transChange> on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory:</q>
Matthew 24:31 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and He will send forth his messengers with a trumpet of a loud voice, and they shall gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.</q>
Matthew 24:32 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Now learn a parable from the fig-tree: when it's branch is tender and bringeth forth leaves, ye know that summer is nigh;</q>
Matthew 24:33 <q marker="" who="Jesus">so ye also, when ye shall see all these <transChange>things,</transChange> know that it is near <transChange>even</transChange> at the doors.</q>
Matthew 24:34 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell you, this generation shall not pass away, till all these be <transChange>fulfilled.</transChange></q>
Matthew 24:35 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.</q>
Matthew 24:36 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But of THAT day and hour knoweth no one, not even the angels of heaven, but my Father only:</q>
Matthew 24:37 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for as the days of Noah <transChange>were,</transChange> so shall be also the coming of the Son of man;</q>
Matthew 24:38 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for as in the days before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, till the day that Noah entered into the ark,</q>
Matthew 24:39 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and knew not <transChange>of it</transChange> till the deluge came and took <transChange>them</transChange> all away; so shall be also the coming of the Son of man.</q>
Matthew 24:40 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Then there shall be two in the field, the one shall be taken and the other left:</q>

Matthew 24:44 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for the Son of man cometh at a time that ye think not of.</q>

Matthew 26:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.26" sID="gen937"/>
Matthew 26:1 And when Jesus had finished these discourses, He said to his disciples,
Matthew 26:2 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye know that after two days the passover is <transChange>to be kept,</transChange>---and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.</q>
Matthew 26:3 <transChange>Now</transChange> the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people were then assembled together into the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas:
Matthew 26:4 and were consulting how they might take Jesus by treachery and put Him to death.
Matthew 26:5 But they said, Not on the feast-day, least there should be a tumult among the people.
Matthew 26:6 And when Jesus was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
Matthew 26:7 there came to Him a woman with an alabaster-<transChange>box</transChange> of very precious ointment, and poured <transChange>it</transChange> on his head as He was at table:
Matthew 26:8 but when his disciples saw <transChange>it,</transChange> they were <transChange>some of them</transChange> provoked <transChange>at it,</transChange> and said, Wherefore <transChange>is</transChange> this waste?
Matthew 26:9 for this ointment might have been sold for a great deal <transChange>of money,</transChange> and given to the poor.
Matthew 26:10 But Jesus, knowing <transChange>what passed,</transChange> said to them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Why do ye give the woman uneasiness? for she has done a good office to me:</q>
Matthew 26:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">(seeing ye have the poor always with you, but me ye have not always:) for <transChange>in</transChange> pouring this ointment on my body,</q>
Matthew 26:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">she has embalmed me for my burial.</q>
Matthew 26:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell you, wherever this gospel is preached, in the whole world, what she hath done shall also be spoken of for a memorial of her.</q>
Matthew 26:14 About this time went one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot,
Matthew 26:15 to the chief priests, and said, What will ye give me, and I will deliver Him to you? and they promised him thirty pieces of silver:
Matthew 26:16 and from that time he sought opportunity to betray Him.
Matthew 26:17 Now upon the first <transChange>day of the feast</transChange> of unleavened bread, came the disciples to Jesus, saying, where wouldest thou have us make preparation for thee to eat the passover?
Matthew 26:18 And He said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Go into the city, to such a man, and tell him, The master saith, my time is near, I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples:</q> and the disciples did as Jesus ordered them,
Matthew 26:19 and prepared the passover.
Matthew 26:20 And when the evening was come, He sat down with the twelve:
Matthew 26:21 and as they were eating, He said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell you, that one of you will betray me.</q>
Matthew 26:22 And they were exceedingly grieved, and said to Him, every one of them, Lord, is it I?
Matthew 26:23 and He answered, <q marker="" who="Jesus">he that dippeth his hand with me in the dish, <transChange>even</transChange> he will betray me.</q>
Matthew 26:24 <q marker="" who="Jesus">The Son of man is going indeed as it is written concerning Him: but wo to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed; it had been good for him, if that man had never been born.</q>
Matthew 26:25 And Judas, who betrayed Him, answered and said, Master, is it I? <transChange>and</transChange> He said unto him, <hi type="italic">It is</hi>.

Matthew 26:27 and He took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave <transChange>it</transChange> to them, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Drink ye all of it:</q>
Matthew 26:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for this is my blood, <transChange>the blood</transChange> of the new covenant, which is <transChange>to be</transChange> shed for many for the remission of sins:</q>
Matthew 26:29 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but I tell you, that from henceforth I shall not drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in the kingdom of my Father.</q>
Matthew 26:30 And when they had sung an hymn, they went out to the mount of Olives.
Matthew 26:31 Then saith Jesus unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ye will all take offence at me this night; for it is written, "I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered:"</q>
Matthew 26:32 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but after I am risen <transChange>again,</transChange> I will go before you into Galilee.</q>
Matthew 26:33 But Peter answered and said to Him, though they should all be offended in thee, <transChange>yet</transChange> will I never be offended.
Matthew 26:34 Jesus said unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell thee that this night, before the cock crow, thou wilt deny me thrice.</q>

Matthew 26:37 and having taken with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, He began to be sorrowful and much distressed;
Matthew 26:38 and saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">My soul is exceeding sorrowful even unto death, stay here and watch with me.</q>

Matthew 26:43 And He came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.
Matthew 26:44 And He left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, <transChange>to</transChange> the same effect.
Matthew 26:45 Then He cometh to his disciples and saith, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Are ye sleeping still and taking your rest? behold, the hour is come, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.</q>
Matthew 26:46 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Rise, let us go, see the traitor is at hand.</q>

Matthew 26:48 (now he that betrayed Him, had given them a signal, saying, <transChange>The man</transChange> whom I shall kiss is He, lay hold of Him:)

Matthew 26:58 and Peter followed Him at a distance, to the high-priest's palace, and went in, and sat with the servants, that he might see the issue.
Matthew 26:59 Now the chief priests and elders, and the whole council sought false-witness against Jesus, that they might put Him to death: but found none.
Matthew 26:60 And tho' many false witnesses came, they found none <transChange>to their purpose.</transChange> But at last came two false witnesses and said,
Matthew 26:61 This <transChange>fellow</transChange> said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.
Matthew 26:62 And the high priest stood up and said to Him, Dost thou make no answer? what do these <transChange>men</transChange> testify against thee? but Jesus made no reply.
Matthew 26:63 Then the high priest said to Him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us, if thou be the Christ, the Son of God.
Matthew 26:64 Jesus saith unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus"><transChange>It is as</transChange> thou hast said: and I tell you, hereafter ye shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.</q>
Matthew 26:65 Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy, what need have we more of witnesses? now ye have heard his blasphemy, what think ye?
Matthew 26:66 and they answered, He ought to be put to death.
Matthew 26:67 Then did they spit in his face, and beat Him about the head; and some struck Him with rods,
Matthew 26:68 saying, Divine to us, <transChange>thou</transChange> Christ, who it is that smote thee.
Matthew 26:69 Now Peter was sitting without in the hall, and one of the maids came to him and said, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee:
Matthew 26:70 but he denied <transChange>it</transChange> before <transChange>them</transChange> all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.

Matthew 26:72 and he denied a second time, <transChange>and that</transChange> with an oath, <transChange>saying,</transChange> I know not the man. And a little after, they that stood <transChange>by</transChange> came to Peter and said,

Matthew 26:74 then he began to curse and to swear, <transChange>saying,</transChange> I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.

Matthew 27:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.27" sID="gen1013"/>
Matthew 27:1 And as soon as it was morning all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus, how to get Him executed:
Matthew 27:2 so they bound Him and led <transChange>Him</transChange> away, and delivered Him to Pontius Pilate the <transChange>Roman</transChange> governor.
Matthew 27:3 Then Judas, who had betrayed Him, when he saw that He was condemned, being struck with remorse, brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders,
Matthew 27:4 saying, I have sinned, for I have betrayed innocent blood: but they said, What <transChange>is that</transChange> to us? see thou <transChange>to that.</transChange>
Matthew 27:5 And he threw <transChange>down</transChange> the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.
Matthew 27:6 But the chief priests took <transChange>up</transChange> the pieces of silver, and said, It is not lawful to put them into the treasury <transChange>of the temple,</transChange> because it is the price of blood:
Matthew 27:7 so they consulted together, and bought with them the potter's field for a burying-<transChange>ground</transChange> for strangers:
Matthew 27:8 and therefore that field is called the field of blood to this day.
Matthew 27:9 Then was fulfilled <transChange>that</transChange> which was spoken by the prophet, saying, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was estimated, on whom the children of Israel set the price,
Matthew 27:10 and gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord appointed me.
Matthew 27:11 And Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked Him, saying, Art thou the king of the Jews? And Jesus answered him, <q marker="" who="Jesus"><transChange>It is as</transChange> thou sayest.</q>
Matthew 27:12 And when he was accused by the chief priests and elders, He answered nothing.
Matthew 27:13 Then saith Pilate to Him, Dost thou not hear how many <transChange>things</transChange> they witness against thee?
Matthew 27:14 but He answered him not one word: so that the governor was much astonished.
Matthew 27:15 Now the governor used at the feast to release a prisoner to the people, whom<transChange>soever</transChange> they desired:
Matthew 27:16 and they had then a notorious malefactor named Barabbas.
Matthew 27:17 Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye <transChange>that</transChange> I release unto you?
Matthew 27:18 Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ? for he knew that out of envy they had delivered Him up.
Matthew 27:19 (And while he was sitting on the tribunal, his wife sent to him, saying, Have nothing to do with that righteous <transChange>man:</transChange> for I have suffered much in a dream to day on his account.)
Matthew 27:20 But the chief priests and elders persuaded the <transChange>common</transChange> people to ask for Barabbas, and <transChange>so</transChange> to destroy Jesus.
Matthew 27:21 And the governor said to them, Which of the two would you have me release to you? and they said, Barabbas.
Matthew 27:22 What shall I do then, saith Pilate, with Jesus, who is called Christ? They all cried out, Let Him be crucified.
Matthew 27:23 And the governor said, Why, what evil hath He done? but they cried out the more, saying, Let Him be crucified.
Matthew 27:24 Pilate seeing that he prevailed nothing, but that rather a tumult was made, took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just man, look ye to <transChange>it:</transChange>
Matthew 27:25 and all the people answered and said, His blood <transChange>be</transChange> on us, and on our children.
Matthew 27:26 Then he released to them Barabbas: but he ordered Jesus to be scourged, and delivered <transChange>Him</transChange> to be crucified.
Matthew 27:27 Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the hall, and gathered the whole band about Him:
Matthew 27:28 and when they had stript Him, they covered Him with a scarlet robe;
Matthew 27:29 and having platted a crown of thorns, they put <transChange>it</transChange> upon his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they bowed the knee before Him in derision, saying, Hail king of the Jews:
Matthew 27:30 and they spit upon Him, and took the reed and struck Him on the head.
Matthew 27:31 And after they had <transChange>thus</transChange> abused Him, they took off the <transChange>scarlet</transChange> robe from Him, and put on Him his own clothes, and led Him away to be crucified.
Matthew 27:32 And as they were going along they met with a man of Cyrene, whose name was Simon; and forced him to carry the cross.
Matthew 27:33 And when they were come to a place called Golgotha, that is to say,
Matthew 27:34 the place of a skull, they gave Him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: but when He had tasted it, He would not drink.
Matthew 27:35 And after they had fixed Him to the cross, they parted his garments, casting lots: that it might be fulfilled, which was spoken by the prophet, They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.
Matthew 27:36 And they sat down and watched Him there: and put up over his head his accusation in writing,
Matthew 27:37 THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Matthew 27:38 And there were two thieves crucified with Him: one on his right hand, and one on the left.
Matthew 27:39 And they that passed by reviled Him, shaking their heads,
Matthew 27:40 and saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest <transChange>it again</transChange> in three days, save thyself: if thou art the Son of God, come down from the cross.
Matthew 27:41 And in like manner the chief priests also insulting Him, with the scribes and elders,
Matthew 27:42 said, He saved others, himself He cannot save: if He be the king of Israel, let Him come down now from the cross, and we will believe Him:
Matthew 27:43 He trusted in God, let Him deliver Him now, if He will <transChange>own</transChange> Him; for He said, I am the Son of God.
Matthew 27:44 And <transChange>one of</transChange> the thieves also, that were crucified with Him, cast the same reproach upon Him.
Matthew 27:45 Now from the sixth hour to the ninth there was darkness over all the land.
Matthew 27:46 And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">"Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani,"</q> that is <transChange>to say,</transChange> <q marker="" who="Jesus">My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?</q>
Matthew 27:47 And some of them that stood by, hearing Him, said, He calls upon Elias:
Matthew 27:48 and immediately one of them ran, and took a spunge, and having filled <transChange>it</transChange> with vinegar put <transChange>it</transChange> upon a reed, and offered <transChange>it</transChange> Him to drink;
Matthew 27:49 the rest said, Stay, let us see whether Elias will come and save Him.
Matthew 27:50 But Jesus cried out again with a loud voice; and <transChange>then</transChange> gave up the ghost.
Matthew 27:51 And behold the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom, and the earth was shaken, and the rocks were split:
Matthew 27:52 and the graves opened, and many bodies of departed saints arose,
Matthew 27:53 and coming out of the graves, after his resurrection, went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.
Matthew 27:54 And when the centurion, and they that were with him guarding Jesus, saw the earthquake, and what was done, they were sore afraid, and said, This was indeed the Son of God.
Matthew 27:55 And several women were there looking on at a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministring unto Him:
Matthew 27:56 among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's children.
Matthew 27:57 And in the evening, there came a rich man of Arimathea, whose name was Joseph, who also himself was a disciple of Jesus, <transChange>and</transChange> went to Pilate,
Matthew 27:58 and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered the body to be delivered <transChange>to him;</transChange>
Matthew 27:59 and Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
Matthew 27:60 and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had <transChange>had</transChange> cut out in the rock; and when he had rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, he went away:
Matthew 27:61 but there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary sitting over against the sepulchre.
Matthew 27:62 Now the next day after the preparation, the chief priests and pharisees went together to Pilate, saying, Sir, we remember that this impostor,
Matthew 27:63 when He was alive, said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">After three days I <transChange>will</transChange> rise <transChange>again:</transChange></q>
Matthew 27:64 order therefore the sepulchre to be secured till the third day, least his disciples should come and steal Him away, and tell the people, He is risen from the dead: and <transChange>so</transChange> the last error will be worse than the first.
Matthew 27:65 But Pilate said to them, Ye have a guard <transChange>of your own,</transChange> go <transChange>and</transChange> make it as secure as ye will.
Matthew 27:66 So they went and made the sepulchre safe, sealing the stone, and setting a guard <transChange>to watch it.</transChange> <chapter eID="gen1013" osisID="Matt.27"/>
Matthew 28:0 <chapter osisID="Matt.28" sID="gen1080"/>
Matthew 28:1 Now after the sabbath, in the dawning towards the first <transChange>day</transChange> of the week, came Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, to look at the sepulchre:
Matthew 28:2 and behold, there had been a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descending from heaven, had come and rolled away the stone from the door, and was sitting upon it:
Matthew 28:3 (and his countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:
Matthew 28:4 and the guards shook for fear of him, and became like dead men:)
Matthew 28:5 and the angel said to the women, Be not ye afraid: for I know that ye seek Jesus who was crucified.
Matthew 28:6 He is not here, for He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay:
Matthew 28:7 and go quickly, and tell his disciples that He is risen from the dead; and behold, He is going before you into Galilee; there ye shall see Him; lo, I have told you.
Matthew 28:8 And they went immediately from the sepulchre, with fear, and great joy, and ran to tell his disciples.
Matthew 28:9 And as they were going to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">God save you.</q> And they drew near and embraced his feet, and worshipped Him.
Matthew 28:10 Then saith Jesus unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Be not afraid, go tell my brethren to repair into Galilee, and there they shall see me.</q>
Matthew 28:11 Now while they were going, behold some of the guard came into the city, and told the chief priests all that had happened:
Matthew 28:12 and they assembled with the elders, and taking counsel <transChange>together</transChange> gave the soldiers <transChange>a</transChange> large <transChange>sum</transChange> of money,
Matthew 28:13 saying, Do you say, that his disciples came by night, and stole Him <transChange>away,</transChange> while we were asleep.
Matthew 28:14 And if this should come to a hearing before the governor, we will satisfy him, and indemnify you.
Matthew 28:15 So they took the money, and did as they were instructed: and this is commonly reported among the Jews to this day.
Matthew 28:16 And the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had appointed them.
Matthew 28:17 And when they saw Him, they worshipped Him: but some doubted.

Mark 0:0 <div osisID="Mark" sID="gen1101" type="book"/>
Mark 1:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.1" sID="gen1102"/>
Mark 1:1 <hi type="bold">The</hi> beginning of the gospel of JESUS CHRIST the Son of GOD.
Mark 1:2 As it is written in the prophets, "Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee:"
Mark 1:3 <transChange>and again,</transChange> "The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight:" <transChange>accordingly</transChange> John came baptizing in the wilderness,
Mark 1:4 and preaching the baptism of repentance in order to the remission of sins;
Mark 1:5 and all the country of Judea, and those of Jerusalem, went out to him, and were all baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.
Mark 1:6 And John was clothed with camels hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins, and he lived upon locusts and wild honey: and he preached,
Mark 1:7 saying, There cometh after me one mightier than I, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop and unloose.
Mark 1:8 I indeed have baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the holy Spirit.
Mark 1:9 And in those days Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in Jordan:
Mark 1:10 and as soon as He came up from the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon Him.
Mark 1:11 And there was a voice from heaven, <transChange>saying,</transChange> This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
Mark 1:12 And immediately the Spirit taketh Him out into the wilderness:
Mark 1:13 and He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan, and among the wild beasts: and angels ministred unto Him.
Mark 1:14 Now after John was cast into prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
Mark 1:15 and saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent, and believe the gospel.</q>
Mark 1:16 And as He was walking by the sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea,
Mark 1:17 (for they were fishermen,) and Jesus said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men:</q>
Mark 1:18 and immediately they left their nets and followed Him.
Mark 1:19 And going a little farther, He saw James <transChange>the son</transChange> of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship, mending their nets, and immediately called them <transChange>likewise:</transChange>
Mark 1:20 and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the men he had hired, and went along with Him.
Mark 1:21 And they went into Capernaum: and going directly into the synagogue on the sabbath, He taught <transChange>the people:</transChange> and they were astonished at his doctrine;
Mark 1:22 for He taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.
Mark 1:23 And there was in their synagogue a man with an impure spirit,
Mark 1:24 and he cried out, saying, Let <transChange>us</transChange> alone, what have we to do with thee, Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee, who thou art, the holy <transChange>one</transChange> of God.
Mark 1:25 And Jesus rebuked him, saying, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Be silent, and come out of him:</q> and the impure spirit threw him into convulsions,
Mark 1:26 and roaring with a loud voice, came out of him.
Mark 1:27 And they were all amazed, so that they inquired of each other, saying, What is this, what new <transChange>kind of</transChange> doctrine <transChange>is</transChange> this? for He commands with authority even the impure spirits, and they obey Him.
Mark 1:28 And straitway his fame spread into all the country <transChange>round</transChange> about Galilee.
Mark 1:29 And as soon as they came out of the synagogue, they went into the house of Simon and Andrew, <transChange>together</transChange> with James and John.
Mark 1:30 And Simon's wife's mother lay sick of a fever: and they immediately told Him of her:
Mark 1:31 and He came to <transChange>her,</transChange> and taking her by the hand raised her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she waited upon them.
Mark 1:32 And in the evening, when the sun set, they brought to Him all that were ill, and demoniacs:
Mark 1:33 and the whole city was gathered together at the door;
Mark 1:34 and He healed many that were ill of various diseases, and cast out many devils, and suffered not the devils to say that they knew Him.
Mark 1:35 And in the morning, before it was light, He rose up and went out, and retired into a solitary place, and there prayed.
Mark 1:36 And Simon, and they <transChange>that were</transChange> with him, went in quest of Him:
Mark 1:37 and when they found Him, they said to Him, all <transChange>the people</transChange> are seeking for thee.
Mark 1:38 And He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Let us go into the neighbouring towns, that I may preach there also; for this was the end of my coming.</q>
Mark 1:39 And He went preaching in their synagogues, through all Galilee, and casting out devils.
Mark 1:40 And there came to Him a leper, beseeching Him, and kneeling down to Him, and saying unto Him, If thou wilt, thou canst cleanse me:
Mark 1:41 and Jesus, being moved with compassion, stretched out <transChange>his</transChange> hand and touched him, and saith unto Him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">I will;</q>
Mark 1:42 be thou healed: and as soon as He had spoken, immediately the leprosy left him, and he was healed.
Mark 1:43 And he gave him a strict charge, and immediately dismissed him,
Mark 1:44 and saith unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">See thou tell no man: but go, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy purification what Moses has commanded, for a testimony to them.</q>
Mark 1:45 But when he was gone he began to publish <transChange>it</transChange> much, and to spread abroad the report: so that Jesus could no more go openly into the city, but kept out in country places: and they came to Him from all parts. <chapter eID="gen1102" osisID="Mark.1"/>
Mark 2:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.2" sID="gen1148"/>
Mark 2:1 And after <transChange>some</transChange> days He went again into Capernaum; and it being heard that He was in the house,
Mark 2:2 great numbers were immediately gathered together, so that there was no more room to contain them, not even about the door: and as he was preaching the word unto them,
Mark 2:3 there came <transChange>some</transChange> to Him, bringing a paralytic <transChange>who was</transChange> carried by four <transChange>men:</transChange>
Mark 2:4 and not being able to come near to Him for the croud, they uncovered the roof where He was, and when they had made an openning, they let down the couch on which the paralytic was laid.
Mark 2:5 And Jesus, seeing their faith, saith to him that had the palsy, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Son, thy sins are forgiven thee.</q>
Mark 2:6 But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
Mark 2:7 Why doth this <transChange>man</transChange> thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God?

Mark 2:12 And he instantly arose, and taking up his couch, went out before <transChange>them</transChange> all, so that <transChange>they</transChange> were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, we never saw the like.
Mark 2:13 And He went out again towards the sea-<transChange>side,</transChange> and all the people resorted to Him, and He taught them.

Mark 2:15 And as He sat at table in his house, many publicans and sinners also sat down with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed Him.
Mark 2:16 And the scribes and pharisees, when they saw Him eating with publicans and sinners, said to his disciples, What <transChange>is the meaning</transChange> that He eateth with publicans and sinners?
Mark 2:17 <transChange>Which</transChange> Jesus hearing, saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">They that are in health have no need of a physician, but they that are ill: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.</q>
Mark 2:18 And as the disciples of John, and of the pharisees used to fast, they came to Him, saying, Why do the disciples of John and of the pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
Mark 2:19 And Jesus said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Can the bridemen fast, when the bridegroom is with them? while the bridegroom is with them, they cannot fast:</q>
Mark 2:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them; and then shall they fast.</q>
Mark 2:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">No man seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment; otherwise, it's new patch teareth from the old, and the rent is made worse:</q>
Mark 2:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">nor does any one put new wine into old vessels; otherwise the new wine bursteth the vessels, and the wine is spilt, and the vessels are destroyed: but new wine should be put into new vessels.</q>
Mark 2:23 And as He was going thro' the corn-<transChange>fields</transChange> on the sabbath-<transChange>day,</transChange> his disciples began as they went along to pluck the ears of corn.
Mark 2:24 And the pharisees said to Him, See, why do they what is not lawful <transChange>to be done</transChange> on the sabbath-day?

Mark 3:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.3" sID="gen1177"/>

Mark 3:2 and they watched Him, whether He would heal him on the sabbath-day, that they might accuse Him.
Mark 3:3 And He said to the man, that had the withered hand, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Rise up into the midst:</q>
Mark 3:4 then saith He to them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill?</q> but they were silent.
Mark 3:5 And when He had looked round upon them with indignation, being grieved at the hardness of their hearts, He saith to the man, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Stretch out thine hand:</q> and he stretched <transChange>it</transChange> out, and his hand was made <transChange>as</transChange> sound as the other.
Mark 3:6 And the pharisees went out, and immediately took counsel with the Herodians against Him, how to destroy Him:
Mark 3:7 but Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the sea.

Mark 3:33 And He answered them, and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Who is my mother, or my brethren?</q>

Mark 4:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.4" sID="gen1213"/>
Mark 4:1 And He began to teach again by the sea-side, and there was gathered unto Him a great multitude; so that He went into a ship, and sat on board, and all the people were by the sea, upon the shore.
Mark 4:2 And He taught them many things by similitudes, and said to them in his instruction,
Mark 4:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">hearken, Behold a sower went out to sow:</q>
Mark 4:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and in sowing, some fell by the way-<transChange>side,</transChange> and the birds came and ate it up:</q>
Mark 4:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth, and it sprang up immediately, because it had not depth of earth;</q>
Mark 4:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but when the sun rose, it was burnt up, and withered because it had no root:</q>
Mark 4:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no fruit:</q>
Mark 4:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and other fell on good ground, and yielded fruit springing up and increasing; and produced some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred-<transChange>fold.</transChange></q>
Mark 4:9 And He said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.</q>
Mark 4:10 And when He was apart <transChange>from the multitude,</transChange> those that were about Him with the twelve asked Him concerning the parable.
Mark 4:11 And he said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">To you it is granted to know the mystery of the kingdom of God; but unto them that are without all things are <transChange>delivered</transChange> in parables:</q>
Mark 4:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">that <transChange>in</transChange> seeing they may see and not perceive, and <transChange>in</transChange> hearing they may hear and not understand, least they should be converted, and <transChange>their</transChange> sins be forgiven them.</q>
Mark 4:13 Then saith He unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Do ye not understand this parable? how then will ye understand all <transChange>my other</transChange> parables.</q>
Mark 4:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">The sower <transChange>is he that</transChange> soweth the word. And these are they by the way-<transChange>side:</transChange></q>
Mark 4:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">where the word is sown; but when they have heard <transChange>it,</transChange> Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word <transChange>that was</transChange> sown in their hearts.</q>
Mark 4:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And in like manner, they that are sown <transChange>as</transChange> on stony grounds are such, as when they hear the word,</q>
Mark 4:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">immediately receive it with joy, but have no root in themselves, <transChange>and so</transChange> continue but for a <transChange>short</transChange> season: <transChange>and</transChange> then, when affliction cometh, or persecution on account of the word, they are <transChange>as</transChange> soon offended.</q>
Mark 4:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And those that are sown <transChange>as</transChange> among thorns, are these: such as hear the word <transChange>indeed,</transChange></q>
Mark 4:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and <transChange>inordinate</transChange> desires after other things entering in choke the word, and <transChange>so</transChange> it becometh unfruitful.</q>
Mark 4:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And these are they who are <transChange>like seed</transChange> sown on good ground: such as hear the word, and receive <transChange>it;</transChange> and bring forth fruit, some thirty-<transChange>fold,</transChange> and some sixty, and some an hundred.</q>
Mark 4:21 And He said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or a bed, <transChange>and</transChange> not to be set on a candlestick?</q>
Mark 4:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for there is nothing hidden, which may not be revealed; nor was there any thing concealed, but in order to become manifest.</q>
Mark 4:23 <q marker="" who="Jesus">If any one hath ears to hear, let him hear.</q>
Mark 4:24 And mind what ye hear: <q marker="" who="Jesus"><transChange>for</transChange> with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you; and more shall be imparted to you that are observant:</q>
Mark 4:25 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for whosoever hath, to him <transChange>more</transChange> shall be given; and he that hath not, even what he hath, <transChange>or seemeth to have,</transChange> shall be taken from him.</q>
Mark 4:26 And He said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">The kingdom of God is as if a man should cast seed into the ground,</q>
Mark 4:27 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up, and increase; he knows not how.</q>
Mark 4:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For the earth produces fruit of itself, first the blade, then the ear, then the full corn in the ear:</q>
Mark 4:29 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but when the fruit is ripe, he immediately puts in the sickle, because the harvest is come.</q>
Mark 4:30 And He said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">To what shall we compare the kingdom of God, or by what similitude shall we represent it?</q>
Mark 4:31 <q marker="" who="Jesus"><transChange>It is</transChange> like to a grain of mustard-seed, which when it is sown in the ground, is one of the lest of all the seeds on the earth:</q>
Mark 4:32 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but after it is sown, it grows up, and becomes greater than all herbs, and produces large branches, so that the birds of the air may lodge under it's shadow.</q>
Mark 4:33 And in many such parables spake He the word to them, as they had ability to hear <transChange>it:</transChange> but spake not to them without a parable.
Mark 4:34 And He explained all to his disciples in private.
Mark 4:35 And the same day, in the evening, He saith to them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Let us go over to the other side.</q>
Mark 4:36 So they dismissed the multitude, and took Him as He was in the ship. But there were other small vessels likewise with Him.
Mark 4:37 And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now <transChange>almost</transChange> full.
Mark 4:38 And He was in the stern asleep on a pillow: and they awake Him, and say unto Him, Master, art thou under no concern that we are perishing?
Mark 4:39 And He rose and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Peace, be still;</q> and the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
Mark 4:40 And He said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Why are ye so fearful? how! have ye no faith?</q>
Mark 4:41 And they were exceedingly afraid, and said to one another, Who is this? that even the wind and the sea obey Him? <chapter eID="gen1213" osisID="Mark.4"/>
Mark 5:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.5" sID="gen1255"/>
Mark 5:1 And they came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
Mark 5:2 And when He was come out of the ship, immediately there met Him from the tombs,
Mark 5:3 a man with an impure spirit, who kept among the tombs; and no one could bind him, not even with chains:
Mark 5:4 for he had often been bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been pulled asunder by him, and the fetters broken; and no man could tame him:
Mark 5:5 and he was always night and day upon the hills and among the sepulchres bawling, and gashing himself with stones.
Mark 5:6 But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped Him,
Mark 5:7 and crying out with a loud voice said, Jesus <transChange>thou</transChange> Son of the most high God, what have I to do with thee? I adjure thee by God, that thou wouldst not torment me:
Mark 5:8 (for He said to him, <q marker="" who="Jesus"><transChange>Thou</transChange> impure spirit, come out of the man.</q>)
Mark 5:9 And He asked him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">What is thy name?</q> And he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many.
Mark 5:10 And he earnestly intreated Him, that He would not send them out of that country.
Mark 5:11 Now there was a great herd of swine feeding upon the mountains:
Mark 5:12 and all the demons intreated Him, saying, Send us to the swine, that we may enter into them.
Mark 5:13 And immediately Jesus permitted them: and the impure spirits went out <transChange>of the man,</transChange> and entered into the swine; and the herd (which were about two thousand,) ran violently down a precipice into the sea, and were suffocated.
Mark 5:14 And they that were feeding the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what was done:
Mark 5:15 and they come to Jesus, and see the demoniac, who had been possessed by the legion, sitting and clothed, and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
Mark 5:16 And when those that saw <transChange>it</transChange> told them what had happened to the demoniac,
Mark 5:17 and concerning the swine, they intreated Him to depart from their borders.
Mark 5:18 And as He went into the ship, the demoniac intreated Him that he might be with Him:
Mark 5:19 but Jesus did not permit him; but saith to him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Go home to thy <transChange>friends,</transChange> and tell them how great <transChange>things</transChange> the Lord hath done for thee, and hath had compassion on thee:</q>
Mark 5:20 and he departed, and published in Decapolis, how great <transChange>things</transChange> Jesus had done for him, and <transChange>they</transChange> were all amazed.
Mark 5:21 And when Jesus passed over again in the ship to the other side, a great multitude was gathered unto Him, nigh unto the sea.
Mark 5:22 And behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, named Jairus; and as soon as he saw Him, he fell at his feet,
Mark 5:23 and earnestly intreated Him, saying, My little daughter is at the point of death, <transChange>I beseech thee</transChange> that thou wouldst come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed, and she will live.
Mark 5:24 So <transChange>Jesus</transChange> went with him, and a great multitude followed Him, and pressed about Him.
Mark 5:25 And a woman who had been in a flux twelve years,
Mark 5:26 and had suffered a great deal from many physicians, and spent all that she had, and received no benefit, but rather grew worse,
Mark 5:27 when she heard of Jesus, came behind Him in the croud, and touched his garment; for she said,
Mark 5:28 If I can <transChange>but</transChange> touch his clothes, I shall be cured.
Mark 5:29 And immediately the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt within herself that she was healed of the disorder.
Mark 5:30 And immediately Jesus, knowing in Himself that power was gone out of Him, turned about in the croud and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Who touched my clothes?</q>
Mark 5:31 And his disciples said unto Him, Thou seest the multitude crouding about thee, and dost thou ask, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Who touched me?</q>
Mark 5:32 and He looked round about to see who had done it.
Mark 5:33 But the woman being afraid and trembling, <transChange>as</transChange> knowing what had been done in her, came and prostrated herself to Him, and told Him all the truth:
Mark 5:34 and He said to her, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Daughter, thy faith has saved thee; go in peace, and be healed of thy disorder.</q>
Mark 5:35 While He was yet speaking, there came <transChange>some</transChange> from the ruler of the synagogue's <transChange>house,</transChange> saying, Thy daughter is dead, why dost thou trouble the Master any more?
Mark 5:36 But Jesus hearing the word that was spoken, immediately saith to the ruler of the synagogue, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Fear not, only believe:</q>
Mark 5:37 and He suffered none to go along with Him, but Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
Mark 5:38 And He cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth a tumult, <transChange>people</transChange> weeping and lamenting greatly:
Mark 5:39 and when He was come in, He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Why do ye take on <transChange>thus</transChange> and weep? the child is not dead, but asleep.</q>
Mark 5:40 And they laughed at Him: but when He had turned <transChange>them</transChange> all out, He taketh the father, and the mother of the child, and those <transChange>three</transChange> that were with Him, and goes in where the child was laid:
Mark 5:41 and taking hold of her hand, He saith unto her, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Talitha, cumi,</q> which is, being interpreted, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Damsel, (I say unto thee) arise:</q>
Mark 5:42 and immediately the damsel rose up and walked; for she was twelve years old; and they were struck with great astonishment.

Mark 6:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.6" sID="gen1299"/>
Mark 6:1 And He went out from thence, and came into his own country, and his disciples attended Him:
Mark 6:2 and when the sabbath was come, He began to teach in the synagogue: and many that heard <transChange>Him</transChange> were astonished, and said, From whence hath He these <transChange>things?</transChange> and what <transChange>is this</transChange> wisdom <transChange>which is</transChange> given unto Him, that even such mighty things are done by his hands?
Mark 6:3 Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and Judas, and Simon? and are not his sisters here among us? and they were prejudiced against Him.
Mark 6:4 But Jesus said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">A prophet is nowhere less honoured, than in his own country, and among his relations, and his own family.</q>
Mark 6:5 And He could do no miracle there, only laying his hands on a few sick people He healed them;
Mark 6:6 and He was amazed at their unbelief. But he went about <transChange>all</transChange> the villages round, teaching.
Mark 6:7 And He calleth unto Him the twelve, and sent them forth two <transChange>and</transChange> two, and gave them power over impure spirits;
Mark 6:8 and ordered them to take nothing for <transChange>their</transChange> journey, but a staff only; no bag, nor bread, nor money in <transChange>their</transChange> purse:
Mark 6:9 but to tie on <transChange>their</transChange> sandals, and not to put on two coats.

Mark 6:14 And king Herod heard <transChange>of Him,</transChange> (for his name was spread abroad,) and he said, John the baptist is risen from the dead, and therefore miraculous powers appear in him.
Mark 6:15 Others said, it is Elias: and others said, it is a prophet, or like one of the prophets.
Mark 6:16 But when Herod heard <transChange>of Him,</transChange> he said, it is John whom I beheaded, he is risen from the dead.
Mark 6:17 For Herod had sent and seized John, and bound him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, because he had married her:
Mark 6:18 For John <transChange>had</transChange> said to Herod, it is not lawful for thee to have thy brother's wife.
Mark 6:19 Wherefore Herodias persecuted him, and would have taken away his life:
Mark 6:20 but could not; for Herod revered John, knowing him to be a just and holy man, and protected him: and when he heard him he did many things <transChange>according to John's instructions,</transChange> and heard him willingly.

Mark 6:22 and dancing, and having pleased Herod and his guests, the king said to the young princess, Ask of me whatever thou wilt, and I will give <transChange>it</transChange> thee.
Mark 6:23 And he gave her his oath <transChange>too,</transChange> whatever thou shalt ask of me, I will give <transChange>it</transChange> thee, even to the half of my kingdom.
Mark 6:24 And she withdrew and consulted her mother, what to ask: and she said, The head of John the baptist.
Mark 6:25 And immediately she came in <transChange>again</transChange> with eagerness to the king, and said, I desire that thou wouldst give me directly the head of John the baptist in a dish.
Mark 6:26 And the king was exceedingly grieved, <transChange>but</transChange> on account of his oath, and those who were at table with <transChange>him,</transChange> he would not refuse her: but immediately sent one of his guard,
Mark 6:27 and ordered his head to be brought:
Mark 6:28 and he went and beheaded him in the prison, and brought his head in a dish, and gave it to the damsel, and the damsel carried it to her mother.
Mark 6:29 And his disciples hearing <transChange>of it,</transChange> came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a sepulchre.
Mark 6:30 And the apostles came together to Jesus, and told Him all <transChange>things,</transChange> both what they had done, and what they had taught.
Mark 6:31 And He said to them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Come ye yourselves apart into a retired place, and rest a little: for there were many coming and going, and they had not time even to eat.</q>
Mark 6:32 And they went away privately in a ship into a desert place.
Mark 6:33 And the people saw them departing, and many took notice of them, and ran thither on foot from all the cities, and got before them, and came together unto Him.
Mark 6:34 And when Jesus came out <transChange>of the ship,</transChange> He saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion towards them; because they were as sheep without a shepherd: and He began to teach them many <transChange>things.</transChange>
Mark 6:35 And when it was now late in the day, his disciples came to Him, and said, this is a desert place, and it is now late:
Mark 6:36 dismiss them, that they may go into the country-places and villages round about, and buy themselves bread; for they have nothing to eat.
Mark 6:37 But He answered them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Do ye give them <transChange>something</transChange> to eat.</q> And they say to Him, shall we go and buy two hundred penny-worth of bread, and give them to eat?
Mark 6:38 But He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">How many loaves have ye? go and see.</q> And when they had examined, they said, Five, and two fishes.
Mark 6:39 And He ordered them to cause all <transChange>the people</transChange> to sit down by companies upon the grass:
Mark 6:40 and they sat down in an oblong square, an hundred by fifty.
Mark 6:41 And when He had taken the five loaves, and the two fishes, He looked up to heaven, and gave thanks; then He brake the loaves and gave <transChange>them</transChange> to his disciples, to set before them; the two fishes likewise He divided among them all.
Mark 6:42 And they did all eat and were <transChange>fully</transChange> satisfied.
Mark 6:43 And they took up of the fragments <transChange>of the bread,</transChange> and of the fishes, twelve baskets full.
Mark 6:44 And they that had eaten were about five thousand men.
Mark 6:45 And immediately He obliged his disciples to get into the ship, and to go before <transChange>Him</transChange> to the other side to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the people:
Mark 6:46 and when He had sent them away, He retired into a mountain to pray.
Mark 6:47 And when the evening was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and He alone upon the land:
Mark 6:48 and He saw them labouring in rowing; (for the wind was contrary:) and about the fourth watch of the night He cometh to them walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.
Mark 6:49 But they seeing Him walking upon the water, thought it was an apparition, and cried out: for they all saw Him and were frighted.
Mark 6:50 And He immediately spake to them, and saith, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Be of good courage, it is I, be not afraid.</q>
Mark 6:51 And He went up into the ship to them, and the wind ceased, and they were exceedingly amazed in themselves, and wondered: not considering <transChange>the miracle of</transChange> the loaves,
Mark 6:52 for their heart was stupified.
Mark 6:53 And they passed over and came to the country of Gennesaret, and put to shore:

Mark 7:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.7" sID="gen1356"/>
Mark 7:1 And there were gathered unto Him the pharisees, and some of the scribes, from Jerusalem;
Mark 7:2 and when they saw some of his disciples eating with impure (that is, unwashed) hands, they found fault:
Mark 7:3 for the pharisees, and <transChange>indeed</transChange> all the Jews, do not eat till they have washed their hands thoroughly, observing the tradition of the ancients.
Mark 7:4 And <transChange>when they come</transChange> from the market, they do not eat till they have washed. And there are many other things, which they have received to observe, <transChange>as</transChange> the washing of cups, and pots, and brass-vessels, and seats.
Mark 7:5 Then the pharisees and the scribes ask Him, Why do not thy disciples walk according to the tradition of the ancients, but eat without washing their hands?
Mark 7:6 But He answered them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Well did Esaias prophesy concerning you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me:</q>
Mark 7:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and in vain do they worship me, teaching for doctrines the injunctions of men.</q>
Mark 7:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">For laying aside the commandment of God, ye retain the tradition of men, <transChange>as</transChange> the washings of pots and cups, and many other such like things.</q>
Mark 7:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And ye expressly annul the commandment of God, that ye may retain your own tradition;</q>
Mark 7:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, He that revileth father or mother, let him be put to death:</q>
Mark 7:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but ye say, If a man tell <transChange>his</transChange> father or mother, That which thou mightest be profited by from me <transChange>is</transChange> Corban, (that is, a gift <transChange>to the temple) it sufficeth:</transChange></q>
Mark 7:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">and <transChange>so</transChange> ye allow him to do nothing more for his father or his mother:</q>
Mark 7:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">making void the word of God by your tradition,. And many such like things ye do.</q>
Mark 7:14 And calling all the people to <transChange>Him,</transChange> He said unto them,
Mark 7:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Hear me all <transChange>of you,</transChange> and understand, There is nothing without a man, <transChange>which</transChange> entring into him can defile him: but <transChange>the things</transChange> proceeding from him are those which defile a man.</q>
Mark 7:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">If any <transChange>one</transChange> hath ears to hear, let him hear.</q>
Mark 7:17 And when He was come into the house, away from the multitude, his disciples asked Him concerning <transChange>the meaning of</transChange> the parable.
Mark 7:18 And He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Are ye so void of understanding also? Do ye not know, that whatsoever from without entreth into a man cannot defile him?</q>
Mark 7:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">because it entreth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all <transChange>his</transChange> food.</q>
Mark 7:20 But said He, <q marker="" who="Jesus">What cometh out of a man, that defileth the man;</q>
Mark 7:21 <q marker="" who="Jesus">for out of the heart of men proceed evil thoughts,</q>
Mark 7:22 <q marker="" who="Jesus">adulteries, fornications, murthers, thefts, avarice, malice, deceit, lasciviousness, envy, slander, pride, folly;</q>

Mark 7:24 And He arose and went from thence to the borders of Tyre and Sidon; and going into a house He would have had no body know it, but He could not be concealed: for a woman,
Mark 7:25 whose child was possessed by an evil spirit, having heard of Him, came and fell at his feet,
Mark 7:26 (now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation,) and she besought Him to cast out the demon from her daughter.
Mark 7:27 But Jesus said unto her, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Let the children first be satisfied: for it is not fit to take the children's bread, and throw <transChange>it</transChange> to the dogs.</q>
Mark 7:28 And she answered and said unto Him, True, Lord, yet the dogs under the table, eat of the children's crumbs.
Mark 7:29 And He said unto her, <q marker="" who="Jesus">For this saying, go thy way, the demon is gone out of thy daughter.</q>
Mark 7:30 And she went away to her house, and found the demon gone out, and her daughter laid on the bed.
Mark 7:31 And departing again out of the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, He came to the sea of Galilee thro' the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
Mark 7:32 And they brought to Him a deaf <transChange>man,</transChange> who had <transChange>likewise</transChange> an impediment in his speech, and pray Him to put his hand upon him.
Mark 7:33 And He took him aside out of the croud, and He spit and put his fingers into his ears, and touched his tongue:
Mark 7:34 and looking up to heaven He sighed, and saith unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Ephphatha,</q> that is, <q marker="" who="Jesus">be opened:</q>
Mark 7:35 and immediately his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake distinctly.
Mark 7:36 And He charged them to tell no one, but the more He charged them, the more they published <transChange>it:</transChange>

Mark 8:11 and the pharirisees came forth, and began to dispute with Him, desiring of Him a sign from heaven, tempting Him.

Mark 8:24 And he looked up, and said, I see men (as it were trees) walking.

Mark 8:28 And they answered, <transChange>Some say,</transChange> John the baptist; and others, Elias; and others, One of the prophets.

Mark 8:31 and began to tell them, that the Son of man must suffer much; and be rejected by the elders, and chief priests, and scribes; and be put to death: and after three days rise again.
Mark 8:32 And this He spake <transChange>plainly and</transChange> openly. Upon which Peter began to rebuke Him.

Mark 9:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.9" sID="gen1433"/>
Mark 9:1 And He said unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell you, that there are some of those who stand here, that shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.</q>
Mark 9:2 And after six days Jesus taketh with Him Peter, and James, and John, and bringeth them up by themselves to a high mountain apart; and was transfigured before them:
Mark 9:3 and his raiment shone, <transChange>being</transChange> exceeding white as snow, so as no fuller on earth can whiten.
Mark 9:4 And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
Mark 9:5 Then said Peter to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: let us make three tabernacles; one for Thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias:
Mark 9:6 for he knew not what to say, for they were sore afraid.
Mark 9:7 And there was a cloud overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son, hear <transChange>ye</transChange> Him.
Mark 9:8 And immediately looking round about, they saw no more <transChange>of</transChange> any one, but Jesus alone with them.
Mark 9:9 And as they came down from the mountain, He charged them to tell no one what they had seen, till after the Son of man were risen from the dead.
Mark 9:10 And they laid hold on that expression, querying among themselves, what means the rising from the dead?
Mark 9:11 Then they asked Him, saying, Why do the scribes say, that Elias must come first?
Mark 9:12 And He answered and told them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Elias doth indeed come first, and settle all things: <transChange>He told them</transChange> likewise how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things and be used contemptuously.</q>
Mark 9:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">But I tell you, that Elias is come, and they have done to him whatever they would, as it is written of him.</q>
Mark 9:14 And when He came to the <transChange>other</transChange> disciples, He saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes disputing with them.
Mark 9:15 And immediately all the people, when they saw Him, were astonished; and running to <transChange>Him,</transChange> saluted Him.
Mark 9:16 And he asked the scribes, <q marker="" who="Jesus">What are ye disputing about?</q>
Mark 9:17 And one of the multitude answered, and said, Master I have brought unto thee my son, who is possessed by a dumb spirit:
Mark 9:18 and wherever it seizeth him, it convulseth him; and he fometh, and gnasheth his teeth, and <transChange>thus</transChange> he pineth away: and I desired thy disciples to cast him out, and they could not.
Mark 9:19 And He answered and said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">O unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I bear with you? bring him to me.</q>
Mark 9:20 And they brought him to Him: and as soon as he saw Him, immediately the spirit threw him into convulsions: and he fell upon the ground, and rolled <transChange>about</transChange> foming.
Mark 9:21 And He asked his father, <q marker="" who="Jesus">How long is it since this befel him?</q> And he said, From a child.
Mark 9:22 And it has often thrown him both into the fire and into the waters to destroy him. But if thou canst do any <transChange>thing,</transChange> have compassion on us and help us.
Mark 9:23 And Jesus said unto him, <q marker="" who="Jesus">If thou canst believe, all things <transChange>are</transChange> possible to him that believeth.</q>

Mark 14:0 <chapter osisID="Mark.14" sID="gen1654"/>
Mark 14:1 Now <transChange>the feast of</transChange> the passover and unleavened bread was within two days: and the chief priests and the scribes were contriving how they might seize Him by treachery and put Him to death.
Mark 14:2 But they said, Not on the feast-<transChange>day,</transChange> least there be a tumult of the people.
Mark 14:3 And when He was at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as He was at table, there came a woman with an alabaster-<transChange>box</transChange> of ointment of spikenard, very valuable; and she brake the box and poured it on his head.
Mark 14:4 And there were some provoked <transChange>at it</transChange> and said, Why was this waste <transChange>made</transChange> of the ointment?
Mark 14:5 For it might have been sold for above three hundred pence, and given to the poor. And they inveighed against her.
Mark 14:6 But Jesus said, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Let her alone, why do ye give her uneasiness?</q>
Mark 14:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">She has done a kind office to me. For ye have the poor always with you, and may do them good, whenever ye will; but me ye have not always.</q>
Mark 14:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">She has done what she could: she has embalmed my body beforehand against the burial.</q>
Mark 14:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Verily I tell you, wheresoever this gospel is preached, through all the world, what she hath done shall also be told for a memorial of her.</q>
Mark 14:10 And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests, in order to betray Him unto them.
Mark 14:11 And they were glad, when they heard <transChange>it,</transChange> and engaged to give him money. And he sought to betray Him at a proper season.

Mark 14:13 And He sendeth two of his disciples, and saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Go into the city, and there will meet you a man carrying a pitcher of water:</q>

Mark 14:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And he will shew you a large upper room ready prepared, there make preparation for us.</q>
Mark 14:16 And his disciples went out, and came into the city, and found <transChange>every thing</transChange> as He told them; and <transChange>so</transChange> prepared the passover.

Mark 14:28 <q marker="" who="Jesus">but after I am risen <transChange>again,</transChange> I will go before you into Galilee.</q>

Mark 14:31 But he said with the more vehemence, Though I should die with thee, I will never disown thee. And so likewise said they all.
Mark 14:32 And they came to a place called Gethsemane, and He saith to his disciples, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Sit here whilst I <transChange>go and</transChange> pray.</q>

Mark 14:34 And He saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">My Soul is exceeding sorrowful even unto death, stay here and watch.</q>

Mark 14:39 And He went away again, and prayed, <transChange>after</transChange> the same manner.
Mark 14:40 And when He returned, He found them again sleeping, for their eyes were heavy; and they knew not what to say to Him.
Mark 14:41 And he cometh the third time, and saith unto them, <q marker="" who="Jesus">Are ye sleeping still and taking your rest? It is enough, the hour is come: behold, the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.</q>

Mark 14:46 And they laid their hands on Him, and apprehended Him.

Mark 14:52 and he let go the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
Mark 14:53 And they led Jesus away to the high priest, with whom were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.
Mark 14:54 And Peter followed Him at a distance, even into the palace of the high priest: and sat down among the servants, and warmed himself at the fire.
Mark 14:55 Now the chief priests and all the council sought for evidence against Jesus, to put Him to death, and found none:
Mark 14:56 for many bare false witness against Him, and the evidences did not agree.
Mark 14:57 At last there rose up some and bare false witness against Him,
Mark 14:58 saying, We heard Him say, I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands:
Mark 14:59 but neither was their evidence consistent.
Mark 14:60 Then the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus saying, Answerest thou nothing? what do these <transChange>men</transChange> witness against thee?
Mark 14:61 but he held his peace, and made <transChange>him</transChange> no answer. <transChange>So</transChange> the high priest asked Him again, and saith to Him, Art thou the Messiah the Son of the blessed <transChange>God?</transChange>

Mark 14:63 Then the high priest rent his clothes and said, What farther need have we of witnesses?
Mark 14:64 ye have heard the blasphemy; what think ye? and they all condemned Him as worthy of death.
Mark 14:65 And they spit upon Him, and blind-folded Him, and <transChange>then</transChange> buffeted Him and said to Him, prophesy <transChange>who it was:</transChange> and the officers struck him with <transChange>their</transChange> rods.
Mark 14:66 And Peter being in the hall below, there came one of the maid-servants of the high priest;

Mark 14:70 And a little after, they that stood by, said to Peter again, Thou art certainly <transChange>one</transChange> of them: for thou art a Galilean, and thy speech is like <transChange>theirs.</transChange>
