I John 3:0 <chapter osisID="1John.3" sID="gen7691"/>
I John 3:1 Behold <transChange>then</transChange> what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the children of God: <transChange>though</transChange> for this <transChange>reason</transChange> the world knoweth us not, because it knew not Him.
I John 3:2 Beloved, we are now the children of God, but it doth not yet appear what we shall be: we know however, that, when He shall appear, we shall be like Him; for we shall see Him as He is.
I John 3:3 And every <transChange>one,</transChange> that hath this hope in Him, purifieth himself, even as He is pure.
I John 3:4 Every <transChange>one</transChange> that committeth sin, transgresseth the law; for sin is the violation of the law.
I John 3:5 And ye know that He was manifested, to take away our sins: and in Him there is no sin.
I John 3:6 Whosoever abideth in Him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen Him, nor known Him.
I John 3:7 Little children, let no one deceive you: he that practiseth righteousness is righteous, even as He is righteous:
I John 3:8 he, that makes a practise of sin, is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning. <transChange>And</transChange> for this the Son of God was manifested, that He might destroy the works of the devil.
I John 3:9 Whosoever is born of God doth not practise sin, because his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.
I John 3:10 In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whosoever doth not practise righteousness, and he who loveth not his brother, is not of God:
I John 3:11 for this is the injunction which ye heard from the beginning, that we should love one another: not as Cain <transChange>who</transChange> was of the evil <transChange>one,</transChange> and slew his brother;
I John 3:12 and why did he slay him? because his own works were evil, and his brother's righteous.
I John 3:13 Wonder not <transChange>then,</transChange> my brethren, if the world hate you:
I John 3:14 <transChange>since</transChange> we know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brethren: he, that loveth not his brother, remaineth in death.
I John 3:15 Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.
I John 3:16 In this we know his love, that He laid down his life for us: and we should <transChange>be ready to</transChange> lay down our lives for the brethren.
I John 3:17 But if any one, who hath the good things of the world, seeth his brother in want, and shutteth up his bowels from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?
I John 3:18 My little children, let us not love in word, or in tongue <transChange>only,</transChange> but in deed and in truth.
I John 3:19 And hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before Him.
I John 3:20 For, if our heart condemn us, God is <transChange>still</transChange> greater than our heart, and knoweth all <transChange>things.</transChange>
I John 3:21 Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, <transChange>then</transChange> have we confidence towards God:
I John 3:22 and whatsoever we ask, we receive from Him, because we keep his commandments, and do the things that are pleasing in his sight.
I John 3:23 And this is his commandment, that we should believe in the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, as He hath given us a charge <transChange>to do.</transChange>

I John 4:0 <chapter osisID="1John.4" sID="gen7716"/>
I John 4:1 Beloved, believe not every Spirit, but try the spirits, whether they be of God: for many false prophets are gone out into the world.
I John 4:2 By this ye <transChange>may</transChange> know the Spirit of God: every Spirit that confesseth Jesus Christ, who is come in the flesh, is of God:
I John 4:3 and every spirit that doth not confess Jesus Christ, who is come in the flesh, is not of God: and this is that <transChange>spirit</transChange> of antichrist, which ye have heard was coming, and is already in the world.
I John 4:4 Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them; because greater is He, that is in you, than he that is in the world.
I John 4:5 They are of the world; therefore they speak <transChange>as men</transChange> of the world, and the world heareth them.
I John 4:6 We are of God: he, that knoweth God, heareth us; <transChange>but</transChange> he, who is not of God, heareth not us. By this we know the Spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.
I John 4:7 Beloved, let us love one another: for love is from God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.
I John 4:8 He, that loveth not, knoweth not God: for God is love.
I John 4:9 In this was the love of God manifested towards us, that God sent his only-begotten Son into the world, that we might live through Him.
I John 4:10 Herein is love; not that we loved God, but that He loved us, and sent his Son <transChange>to be</transChange> a propitiation for our sins.
I John 4:11 Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.
I John 4:12 No one hath ever seen God: <transChange>but</transChange> if we love one another, God dwelleth in us and his love is perfected in us.
I John 4:13 By this we know that we are in Him, and He in us; because He hath given us of his Spirit.
I John 4:14 And we have seen, and do testify, that the Father hath sent the Son <transChange>to be</transChange> the Saviour of the world.
I John 4:15 Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.
I John 4:16 And we have known and believed the love which God hath towards us: <transChange>for</transChange> God is love; and he, that dwelleth in love, dwelleth in God, and God in him.
I John 4:17 Herein is love perfected with us, that we may have boldness in the day of judgement; for as He is, we also are in this world.
I John 4:18 There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear; because fear hath torment; but he that feareth is not perfected in love.
I John 4:19 We love Him, because He first loved us. If any <transChange>one</transChange> say,
I John 4:20 I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for how can he, that loveth not his brother, whom he hath seen, love God whom he hath not seen?
I John 4:21 And we have this commandment from Him, that he, who loveth God, should love his brother also. <chapter eID="gen7716" osisID="1John.4"/>

I John 5:3 For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous.

I John 5:5 Who <transChange>then</transChange> is he that overcometh the world, but he who believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

II John 1:1 <hi type="bold">The</hi> elder unto the excellent Lady, and her children, whom I love in truth: and not I only, but also all they that have known the truth;
II John 1:2 for the sake of the truth which dwelleth in us, and will be with us for ever:
II John 1:3 grace, mercy, <transChange>and</transChange> peace be with you from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.
II John 1:4 I rejoiced greatly that I found among thy children such as walked in truth, as we received commandment from the Father.
II John 1:5 And now I beseech thee, Lady, not as writing to thee a new commandment, but <transChange>that</transChange> which we had from the beginning, that we may love one another.
II John 1:6 And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments. This is the commandment, as ye heard from the beginning, that ye should walk in it.
II John 1:7 For many deceivers are come out into the world, who disown that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh. Such a one is a deceiver and an antichrist.

Revelation of John 3:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.3" sID="gen7871"/>
Revelation of John 3:1 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And to the angel of the church in Sardis write, These <transChange>things</transChange> saith He that hath the seven spirits of God, and the seven stars; I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead:</q>
Revelation of John 3:2 <q marker="" who="Jesus">be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die; for I have not found thy works perfect in the sight of God.</q>
Revelation of John 3:3 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and hold fast, and repent: for if thou be not watchful, I will come upon thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know <transChange>at</transChange> what hour I will come upon thee.</q>
Revelation of John 3:4 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Thou hast a few names even in Sardis, which have not defiled their garments, and they shall walk with me in white; for they are worthy.</q>
Revelation of John 3:5 <q marker="" who="Jesus">He that overcometh shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name from the book of life; but I will own his name before my Father, and before his angels.</q>
Revelation of John 3:6 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Let him, that hath an ear, hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.</q>
Revelation of John 3:7 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write, These <transChange>things</transChange> saith the holy <transChange>One,</transChange> He that is true, He that hath the key of David, He that openeth and no one shutteth, and shutteth and no one openeth:</q>
Revelation of John 3:8 <q marker="" who="Jesus">I know thy works, <transChange>and</transChange> behold I have given thee an open door, and no one shall be able to shut it; for thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.</q>
Revelation of John 3:9 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Behold, I <transChange>will</transChange> give <transChange>up</transChange> those of the synagogue of Satan, who say they are Jews, and are not, but speak falsely; behold, I will make them come and bow before thy feet, and they shall know that I have loved thee.</q>
Revelation of John 3:10 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation, which is to come upon the whole world, to try those that dwell upon the earth.</q>
Revelation of John 3:11 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Behold, I come quickly; hold fast what thou hast, that no one may take thy crown.</q>
Revelation of John 3:12 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Him, that overcometh, I will make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go out no more: and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, (the new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God,) and my <transChange>own</transChange> new name.</q>
Revelation of John 3:13 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Let him, that hath an ear, hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.</q>
Revelation of John 3:14 <q marker="" who="Jesus">And to the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write, These <transChange>things</transChange> saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God; I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot:</q>
Revelation of John 3:15 <q marker="" who="Jesus">I wish thou wert cold or hot.</q>
Revelation of John 3:16 <q marker="" who="Jesus">So <transChange>then,</transChange> because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will cast thee out of my mouth:</q>
Revelation of John 3:17 <q marker="" who="Jesus">because thou sayst, I am rich, and wealthy, and have want of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked.</q>
Revelation of John 3:18 <q marker="" who="Jesus">I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou mayst be rich; and white raiment that thou mayst be clothed, and <transChange>that</transChange> the shame of thy nakedness may not appear: and anoint thine eyes with eye-salve, that thou mayst see.</q>
Revelation of John 3:19 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Whomsoever I love, I reprove and chasten: be zealous therefore and repent.</q>
Revelation of John 3:20 <q marker="" who="Jesus">Behold, I stand at the door and knock: if any <transChange>one</transChange> hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.</q>

Revelation of John 4:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.4" sID="gen7894"/>

Revelation of John 4:2 And immmediately I was in the Spirit: and behold, a throne was set in heaven, and <transChange>one</transChange> sitting on the throne.
Revelation of John 4:3 And He that sat <transChange>upon it,</transChange> was to look at like a jasper and a sardine stone, and <transChange>there was</transChange> a rainbow round the throne like the appearance of an emerald.
Revelation of John 4:4 And around the throne were four and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw twenty four elders sitting, clothed in white garments; and they had upon their heads crowns of gold.
Revelation of John 4:5 And out of the throne came lightnings, and thunders, and voices: and <transChange>there were</transChange> seven lamps of fire burning before the throne; which are the seven spirits of God.
Revelation of John 4:6 And before the throne <transChange>was</transChange> a sea of glass, like crystal: and in the middle of the throne, and the circle of it, <transChange>were</transChange> four animate beings full of eyes before and behind.
Revelation of John 4:7 And the first <transChange>was</transChange> like a lion, and the second like a calf, and the third had a face like a man, and the fourth <transChange>was</transChange> like a flying eagle.
Revelation of John 4:8 And the four animals had each of them six wings round about, and within <transChange>were</transChange> full of eyes; and they cease not day and night saying, Holy, holy, holy <transChange>is the</transChange> Lord God almighty, who was, and who is, and who is to come.
Revelation of John 4:9 And when the animals give glory and honor and thanks to Him that sitteth on the throne,
Revelation of John 4:10 who liveth for ever and ever, the four and twenty elders fall down before Him that sitteth on the throne, and worship Him that liveth for ever and ever,

Revelation of John 5:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.5" sID="gen7906"/>
Revelation of John 5:1 And I saw on the right <transChange>hand</transChange> of Him that sat on the throne a book written within and without, sealed with seven seals:
Revelation of John 5:2 and I saw a mighty angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book and to loose the seals of it?
Revelation of John 5:3 And no one in heaven, nor on earth, nor under the earth, was able to open the book, or to look into it:
Revelation of John 5:4 and I wept much because no one was found worthy to open and read the book, nor to look into it.
Revelation of John 5:5 And one of the elders said to me, Weep not;---Behold the lion of the tribe of Juda, the root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose its seven seals.
Revelation of John 5:6 And I beheld, and lo, in the midst of the throne, and of the four animals, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb, as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of God, sent forth into all the earth.
Revelation of John 5:7 And He came and took the book out of the right hand of Him that sat upon the throne.
Revelation of John 5:8 And when He had taken the book, the four animals, and the twenty four elders, fell down before the Lamb, having every one harps and golden vials full of perfumes, which are the prayers of the saints.
Revelation of John 5:9 And they sung a new song, saying, Worthy art thou to take the book, and to open its seals; for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood, out of every tribe, and tongue, and people, and nation;
Revelation of John 5:10 and hast made us to our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.
Revelation of John 5:11 And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round the throne and the animals and the elders: and the number of them was myriads of myriads, and thousands of thousands;
Revelation of John 5:12 saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain, to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honor, and glory, and blessing.
Revelation of John 5:13 And I heard every creature in heaven, and on earth, and under the earth, and on the sea, and all <transChange>that are</transChange> in them, saying, Blessing, and honor, and glory, and power <transChange>be</transChange> unto Him that sitteth upon the throne, and to the Lamb, for ever and ever.
Revelation of John 5:14 And the four animals said, Amen: and the twenty four elders fell down and worshipped Him that liveth to endless ages. <chapter eID="gen7906" osisID="Rev.5"/>
Revelation of John 6:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.6" sID="gen7921"/>
Revelation of John 6:1 And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard one of the four animate beings saying, as with a voice of thunder, Come and see.
Revelation of John 6:2 And I saw, and behold a white horse; and He that sat upon it had a bow, and a crown was given Him, and He went forth conquering and to conquer.
Revelation of John 6:3 And when He opened the second seal, I heard the second animal saying, Come and see.
Revelation of John 6:4 And there came out another horse, <transChange>which was</transChange> red: and it was given to him, that sat upon it, to take peace from the earth, that they should kill one another: and there was given him a great sword.
Revelation of John 6:5 And when He opened the third seal, I heard the third animal say, Come and see. And I beheld, and lo, a black horse, and he that sat upon it had a balance in his hand.

Revelation of John 6:7 And when He opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth animal saying, Come and see.
Revelation of John 6:8 And I saw, and behold a pale horse, and the name of him that sat upon it was Death, and Hades followed him: and power was given them to slay a fourth part of the earth, by sword, and by famine, and by pestilence, and by wild beasts.
Revelation of John 6:9 And when He opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those that had been slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they maintained.
Revelation of John 6:10 And they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on those that dwell upon the earth?
Revelation of John 6:11 And white robes were given to each <transChange>of them,</transChange> and it was told them to rest a little while longer, till <transChange>the number of</transChange> their fellow-servants, and their brethren that should be killed as they <transChange>were,</transChange> should be complete.

Revelation of John 6:13 and the stars of heaven fell to the earth, as a fig-tree droppeth it's unripe figs, when shaken by a strong wind;
Revelation of John 6:14 and the heaven passed away as a book rolled up, and every mountain and island were moved out of their places:
Revelation of John 6:15 and the kings of the earth, and the grandees, and the rich <transChange>men,</transChange> and the chief captains, and the mighty <transChange>men,</transChange> and every slave, and every free <transChange>man,</transChange> hid themselves in the caverns and in the rocks of the mountains;

Revelation of John 7:14 And I said unto him, Sir, thou knowest. And he said to me, These are they who come out of great affliction, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
Revelation of John 7:15 Therefore they are before the throne of God, and serve Him day and night in his temple: and He that sitteth upon the throne shall dwell among them.

Revelation of John 8:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.8" sID="gen7957"/>
Revelation of John 8:1 And when He opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour:
Revelation of John 8:2 and I saw the seven angels, that stood before God; and seven trumpets were given to them.
Revelation of John 8:3 And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given to Him much incense, that He might present <transChange>it</transChange> with the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar, <transChange>which was</transChange> before the throne.
Revelation of John 8:4 And the smoke of the incense went up <transChange>with</transChange> the prayers of the saints, out of the hand of the angel, before God.
Revelation of John 8:5 And the angel took the censer, and filled it with fire of the altar, and cast <transChange>it</transChange> upon the earth: and there were voices, and thunders, and lightnings, and an earthquake.
Revelation of John 8:6 And the seven angels, that had the seven trumpets, prepared themselves to sound <transChange>their</transChange> trumpets.
Revelation of John 8:7 And the first angel sounded <transChange>his</transChange> trumpet, and there was hail and fire mingled with blood, and it was cast <transChange>down</transChange> upon the earth: and a third part of the trees and every green herb was burnt up.
Revelation of John 8:8 And the second angel sounded, and <transChange>I saw</transChange> as it were a great mountain on fire cast into the sea, and a third part of the sea became blood.
Revelation of John 8:9 And a third part of the creatures in the sea, that had life, died; and a third part of the ships were destroyed.
Revelation of John 8:10 And the third angel sounded, and there fell from heaven a great star burning like a torch, and it fell upon a third part of the rivers, and the fountains of waters: and the name of the star is Wormwood;
Revelation of John 8:11 and a third part of the waters became <transChange>as</transChange> wormwood: and many men died of the waters, because they were bitter.
Revelation of John 8:12 And the fourth angel sounded, and a third part of the sun was smitten, and a third part of the moon, and a third part of the stars; so that the third part of them was darkened, and the day lost a third part of it's light, and the night likewise.
Revelation of John 8:13 And I beheld, and heard an angel flying in the midst of heaven saying with a loud voice, Wo, wo, wo to the inhabitants on the earth from the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels, that are yet to sound. <chapter eID="gen7957" osisID="Rev.8"/>

Revelation of John 9:3 And out of the smoke there came forth locusts upon the earth; and power was given them, <transChange>even</transChange> as the scorpions of the earth have power.
Revelation of John 9:4 And order was given them, not to hurt the grass of the earth, nor any green <transChange>thing,</transChange> nor any tree; but only the men, who had not the seal of God on their foreheads.

Revelation of John 9:15 And the four angels were let loose; who were prepared for an hour, and a day, and a month, and a year, to kill the third <transChange>part</transChange> of men.
Revelation of John 9:16 And the number of <transChange>their</transChange> armies <transChange>was</transChange> two hundred millions: for I heard the number of them.
Revelation of John 9:17 And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and those that sat on them, <transChange>that is,</transChange> having breast-plates of fire, and of jacinth, and brimstone: and the heads of the horses <transChange>were</transChange> like the heads of lions, and out of their mouths came fire, and smoke, and brimstone.

Revelation of John 10:1 And I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven invested with a cloud: and <transChange>there was</transChange> a rainbow on his head, and his face <transChange>was</transChange> as the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire.
Revelation of John 10:2 And he had in his hand a little book open: and he set his right foot upon the sea, and <transChange>his</transChange> left upon the earth.
Revelation of John 10:3 And he cried with a loud voice like the roaring of a lion; and when he had cried, seven thunders uttered their voices.
Revelation of John 10:4 And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices, I was going to write: but I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Seal up what the seven thunders spake, and write them not.
Revelation of John 10:5 And the angel which I saw standing on the sea and on the earth,
Revelation of John 10:6 lifted up his hand to heaven, and sware by Him that liveth for ever, who created the heaven and the things therein, and the earth and the things <transChange>that are</transChange> in it, and the sea and the things therein, that there shall be time no longer:
Revelation of John 10:7 but in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall sound <transChange>his</transChange> trumpet, the mystery of God shall be finished, as He hath declared to his servants the prophets.
Revelation of John 10:8 And the voice, which I heard from heaven, spake to me again, and said, Go, take the little book <transChange>which is</transChange> open in the hand of the angel that standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.
Revelation of John 10:9 And I went to the angel, and said to him, Give me the little book. And he said to me, Take <transChange>it,</transChange> and eat it up: and it shall make thy belly bitter, but in thy mouth it will be sweet as honey.

Revelation of John 11:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.11" sID="gen8005"/>
Revelation of John 11:1 And there was given me a reed like a <transChange>measuring</transChange> rod; and the angel stood and said, Rise and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and <transChange>the extent of</transChange> those that worship at it.
Revelation of John 11:2 But leave the outer court of the temple, and measure it not, for it is given to the gentiles: and they shall trample on the holy city forty two months.
Revelation of John 11:3 And I will give <transChange>power</transChange> to my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred <transChange>and</transChange> sixty days, clothed in sackcloth.
Revelation of John 11:4 These are the two olive-trees, and two candlesticks that stand before the God of the earth.
Revelation of John 11:5 And if any one seek to injure them, fire cometh out of their mouth, and devoureth their enemies: yea, if any one shall desire to injure them, thus shall he be slain.
Revelation of John 11:6 These have power to shut the heavens, so that no rain may fall in the days of their prophecy: and they have power over the waters to turn them into blood, and to smite the earth with every plague as often as they will.
Revelation of John 11:7 And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the abyss, will make war against them, and overcome them, and kill them.
Revelation of John 11:8 And their dead bodies <transChange>shall fall</transChange> in the street of the great city, which is spiritually called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.
Revelation of John 11:9 And <transChange>various</transChange> people, and tribes, and tongues, and nations, shall see their dead bodies three days and an half, and not suffer their corpses to be buried.
Revelation of John 11:10 And those that dwell upon the earth shall triumph over them, and be merry, and send presents to one another: because these two prophets had tormented those that dwelt on the earth.
Revelation of John 11:11 But after three days and an half the spirit of life from God entered into them: and they stood upon their feet, and great fear fell upon those that saw them.
Revelation of John 11:12 And they heard a great voice from heaven, saying to them, Come up hither; and they ascended up to heaven in a cloud, and their enemies beheld them.
Revelation of John 11:13 And at that time there was a great earthquake, and a tenth <transChange>part</transChange> of the city fell, and in the earthquake were killed seven thousand men: and the rest were terrified, and gave glory to the God of heaven.
Revelation of John 11:14 The second wo is past, <transChange>and</transChange> behold the third wo is coming quickly.
Revelation of John 11:15 And the seventh angel sounded <transChange>his</transChange> trumpet, and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of the world are become <transChange>the kingdoms</transChange> of our Lord, and of his Anointed, and He shall reign for ever and ever.

Revelation of John 12:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.12" sID="gen8025"/>
Revelation of John 12:1 And there appeared a great sign in heaven, a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars.
Revelation of John 12:2 And being with child, she cried out in travail, labouring to be delivered.
Revelation of John 12:3 And there appeared another sign in heaven, and behold, a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns; and upon his heads seven crowns.
Revelation of John 12:4 And his tail drew a third <transChange>part</transChange> of the stars of heaven, and cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman, who was ready to bring forth, that when she was delivered, he might devour her child.
Revelation of John 12:5 And she brought forth a male child, who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron: and her child was caught up unto God, and to his throne.
Revelation of John 12:6 And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they might nourish her there a thousand two hundred <transChange>and</transChange> sixty days.
Revelation of John 12:7 And there was war in heaven, Michael and his angels fought against the dragon: and the dragon fought, and his angels;
Revelation of John 12:8 but <transChange>these</transChange> prevailed not, neither was their place found <transChange>any</transChange> more in heaven.
Revelation of John 12:9 And the great dragon was cast <transChange>out,</transChange> that old serpent, called the devil and Satan, who deceiveth the whole world: he was cast <transChange>down</transChange> to the earth, and his angels were cast <transChange>down</transChange> with him.
Revelation of John 12:10 And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, Now is come the salvation, and the power, and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ: for the accuser of our brethren is cast down, who accused them before our God day and night.
Revelation of John 12:11 And they have overcome him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony, and they loved not their life unto the death.
Revelation of John 12:12 Therefore rejoice, ye heavens, and ye that dwell in them: <transChange>but</transChange> wo to the inhabitants of the earth and of the sea; for the devil is come down to you, in great rage, knowing that he hath <transChange>but</transChange> a short time.

Revelation of John 12:16 But the earth helped the woman, and opened it's mouth, and swallowed up the flood, which the dragon threw out of his mouth.

Revelation of John 13:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.13" sID="gen8043"/>
Revelation of John 13:1 And I stood upon the sand of the sea, and I saw a beast rising up out of the sea, which had seven heads and ten horns; and upon his horns ten crowns, and upon his heads the names of blasphemy.
Revelation of John 13:2 And the beast which I saw was like a leopard, and his feet as <transChange>the feet</transChange> of a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion: and the dragon gave him his power, and his throne, and great authority.
Revelation of John 13:3 And I saw one of his heads as it were mortally wounded, but his deadly wound was healed: and all the earth wondered <transChange>and went</transChange> after the beast.
Revelation of John 13:4 And they worshipped the dragon, who gave <transChange>his</transChange> power to the beast, and they worshipped the beast <transChange>likewise,</transChange> saying, Who <transChange>is</transChange> like unto the beast? who is able to make war against him?
Revelation of John 13:5 And there was given him a mouth speaking great and blasphemous <transChange>things,</transChange> and power was given him to make war forty two months.
Revelation of John 13:6 And he opened his mouth in blasphemies against God, to blaspheme his name, and his tabernacle, and those that dwell in heaven.
Revelation of John 13:7 And he was permitted to make war upon the saints, and to overcome them: and power was given him over every tribe, and tongue, and nation.
Revelation of John 13:8 So that all who dwell upon the earth shall worship him, whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.
Revelation of John 13:9 If any one hath an ear, let him hear. Whosoever leadeth into captivity shall go away into captivity:
Revelation of John 13:10 and he, that killeth with the sword, shall be slain with the sword. Here <transChange>then</transChange> is the patience and faith of the saints.
Revelation of John 13:11 And I saw another beast ascending out of the earth, and he had two horns like a lamb; but he spake like a dragon.
Revelation of John 13:12 And he exerciseth all the authority of the first beast in his presence; and makes the earth, and those that dwell in it, to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.
Revelation of John 13:13 And he doth great wonders, so that even maketh fire to come down from heaven to earth in the sight of men; and deceiveth those that dwell on the earth,
Revelation of John 13:14 by the signs which it was given him to do in the presence of the beast, telling the inhabitants of the earth to make an image to the beast, that had <transChange>received</transChange> the wound of the sword, and <transChange>yet</transChange> lived.
Revelation of John 13:15 And he was permitted to give life to the image of the beast, that it might both speak, and cause all those who would not worship the image of the beast to be slain.
Revelation of John 13:16 And he maketh all, both small and great, rich and poor, free-<transChange>men</transChange> and slaves, to receive a mark on their right hand, or on their foreheads: and that no one might buy or sell,
Revelation of John 13:17 but he that hath the mark, or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

Revelation of John 14:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.14" sID="gen8062"/>
Revelation of John 14:1 Then I looked and behold a Lamb standing on mount Sion, and with Him an hundred forty <transChange>and</transChange> four thousand, having his Father's name written on their foreheads.

Revelation of John 14:3 and they sung as it were a new song before the throne; and before the four living ones, and the elders: and none could learn the song, but the hundred <transChange>and</transChange> forty four thousand, who are redeemed from the earth.

Revelation of John 14:15 And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to Him that sat upon the cloud, Put in thy sickle and reap; for the time to reap is come, for the harvest of the earth is ripe.
Revelation of John 14:16 And He that sat upon the cloud put forth his sickle on the earth, and the earth was reaped.
Revelation of John 14:17 And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, and he also had a sharp sickle.
Revelation of John 14:18 And another angel came out from the altar, who had power over the fire; and he called out with a loud cry to Him that had the sharp sickle, saying, Put in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for its grapes are ripe.

Revelation of John 16:9 And men were scorched with great heat, and they blasphemed the name of God, who hath power over these plagues, and they repented not to give Him glory.

Revelation of John 16:11 And they blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores; and they repented not of their works.
Revelation of John 16:12 And the sixth angel poured out his vial upon the great river Euphrates; and its water was dried up, that the way of the kings from the east might be prepared.

Revelation of John 17:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.17" sID="gen8114"/>
Revelation of John 17:1 And there came one of the seven angels, that had the seven vials, and talked with me and said, Come hither, <transChange>and</transChange> I will shew thee the judgement of the great harlot, that sitteth upon many waters:

Revelation of John 17:3 And he transported me in spirit into the wilderness, and I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet-coloured beast, full of blasphemous names, having seven heads and ten horns.
Revelation of John 17:4 And the woman was arrayed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls, having a golden cup in her hand, full of the stench and filth of her whoredom.
Revelation of John 17:5 And upon her forehead <transChange>was</transChange> a name written, "Mystery, Babylon the great, the mother of harlots, and of the abominations of the earth."
Revelation of John 17:6 And I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus: and when I saw her, I wondered with great amazement.
Revelation of John 17:7 And the angel said unto me, Why dost thou wonder? I will tell thee the mystery of the woman and of the beast that carrieth her, which hath the seven heads and ten horns.
Revelation of John 17:8 The beast, which thou sawest, was, and is not; but will rise out of the abyss, and go into perdition: and they that dwell on the earth (whose names are not written on the book of life from the foundation of the world) shall wonder, when they behold the beast that was, and is not, and yet is <transChange>to be.</transChange>

Revelation of John 17:11 And the beast that was, and is not, he is the eighth, and is <transChange>as one</transChange> of the seven, and goeth into perdition.
Revelation of John 17:12 And the ten horns, which thou sawest, are ten kings, who have not yet received a kingdom, but <transChange>shall</transChange> receive power as kings <transChange>for</transChange> a <transChange>limited</transChange> time with the beast.
Revelation of John 17:13 These are of one mind, and will give their power and authority to the beast.
Revelation of John 17:14 These will make war with the Lamb, and the Lamb shall overcome them: for He is Lord of lords, and King of kings: and those <transChange>that are</transChange> with Him are called, and chosen, and faithful.
Revelation of John 17:15 And he said unto me, The waters which thou sawest, whereon the harlot sitteth, are people, and multitudes, and nations, and tongues.
Revelation of John 17:16 And the ten horns which thou sawest upon the beast, these shall hate the whore, and shall make her desolate and naked, and shall devour her flesh, and burn her with fire.

Revelation of John 18:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.18" sID="gen8133"/>
Revelation of John 18:1 And after these <transChange>things</transChange> I saw an<transChange>other</transChange> angel come down from heaven, having great power; and the earth was enlightened with his glory.
Revelation of John 18:2 And he cried with vehemence, <transChange>and</transChange> with a loud voice, saying, Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is become the habitation of demons, a den of impure spirits, and a cage for every unclean and hateful bird.
Revelation of John 18:3 For all nations have drunk of the wine of her furious whoredom, and the kings of the earth have committed whoredom with her, and the merchants of the earth are grown rich by the abundance of her luxury.
Revelation of John 18:4 And I heard another voice from heaven, saying, Come out from her, my people, that ye be not partakers of her sins, and that ye may not suffer by her plagues:
Revelation of John 18:5 for her sins have reached unto heaven, and God hath remembered her iniquities.
Revelation of John 18:6 Give to her as she hath given to you, and repay her double according to her works: in the cup, which she hath mixed, mix for her double.
Revelation of John 18:7 As much as she hath glorified herself and indulged to luxury, so much torment and sorrow give her; because she saith in her heart, I sit <transChange>as</transChange> a queen, I am not a widow, and I shall see no sorrow.
Revelation of John 18:8 Therefore in one day shall her plagues come, <transChange>even</transChange> death and mourning and famine; and she shall be burnt with fire: for strong <transChange>is</transChange> the Lord God who judgeth her.
Revelation of John 18:9 And the kings of the earth, who have committed lewdness and lived luxuriously with her, shall bemoan her and lament for her, when they see the smoke of her burning;
Revelation of John 18:10 standing afar off for fear of her torment, saying, Alas, alas, the great city Babylon, that powerful city! for in one hour is thy judgement come.
Revelation of John 18:11 And the merchants of the earth shall bewail and mourn over her, because no one will buy their merchandize any more:
Revelation of John 18:12 the lading of gold, and silver, and precious stones, and pearl, and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and all <transChange>sorts of</transChange> thyine wood, and vessels of ivory, and of the most precious wood, and of brass, and iron, and marble;
Revelation of John 18:13 and <transChange>their</transChange> cinnamon, and perfumes, and <transChange>sweet</transChange> ointment, and incense, and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and wheat, and cattle, and sheep, and horses, and chariots, and slaves, <transChange>yea</transChange> and the souls of men.
Revelation of John 18:14 And the fruits, which thy soul longed after, are gone from thee, and all <transChange>thy</transChange> delicate and splendid things are departed, and thou shalt find them no more.
Revelation of John 18:15 The merchants of these <transChange>things,</transChange> who grew rich by <transChange>their trade with</transChange> her, shall stand afar off for fear of her torment, weeping and mourning,
Revelation of John 18:16 and saying, Alas, alas, the great city, that was clothed in fine linen, and purple, and scarlet, and adorned with gold, and precious stones, and pearls!
Revelation of John 18:17 for in one hour is so great wealth laid waste. And every pilot, and all on board the ships, and the mariners, and all that traffic by sea, stood afar off,
Revelation of John 18:18 and cried out, when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, What <transChange>city is</transChange> like to this great city?
Revelation of John 18:19 And they threw dust on their heads, and cried out, weeping and moaning, saying, Alas, alas, that great city, in which all that had ships at sea were enriched by her sumptuous expences! for in one hour she is become desolate.
Revelation of John 18:20 Rejoice over her, O heaven, and ye holy apostles and prophets, for God hath avenged you on her.
Revelation of John 18:21 And a mighty angel took up a stone like a great milstone, and cast it into the sea, saying, Thus shall the great city Babylon be thrown <transChange>down</transChange> with violence, and never be found more.
Revelation of John 18:22 And the voice of harpers, and musicians, and pipers, and trumpeters, shall be heard in thee no more: and no artist of any art whatsoever shall be found in thee any more; and the sound of a milstone shall be heard in thee no more.
Revelation of John 18:23 And the light of a candle shall be seen in thee no more; and the voice of the bridegroom and bride shall be heard no more in thee: for thy merchants were the great men of the earth, and by thy sorceries were all nations deceived.

Revelation of John 19:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.19" sID="gen8158"/>
Revelation of John 19:1 And after these <transChange>things</transChange> I heard a loud voice as of a great multitude in heaven, saying, Alleluia; salvation, and glory, and honor, and power to the Lord our God: for true and righteous are his judgements;
Revelation of John 19:2 He hath judged the great whore, who corrupted the earth with her fornication, and hath avenged the blood of his servants at her hand:
Revelation of John 19:3 (and again they said, Alleluia:) and her smoke ascendeth for ever and ever.
Revelation of John 19:4 And the four and twenty elders, and the four animals fell down and worshipped God that sat upon the throne, saying, Amen; Alleluia.
Revelation of John 19:5 And a voice came out from the throne, saying, Praise our God, all ye his servants, and ye that fear Him, both small and great.
Revelation of John 19:6 And I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude, and as the noise of many waters, and as the sound of mighty thunders, saying, Alleluia, for the Lord God the almighty reigneth.
Revelation of John 19:7 Let us rejoice and exult and give glory to Him: for the marriage of the Lamb is come, and his wife hath made herself ready.
Revelation of John 19:8 And it was given to her, that she should be arrayed in fine linen clean and bright: for the fine linen is the righteousness of the saints.
Revelation of John 19:9 And he said unto me, Write, Happy they who are invited to the marriage-supper of the Lamb. And he said unto me, These are the true words of God.
Revelation of John 19:10 And I fell at his feet to worship him: and he said unto me, See <transChange>thou do it</transChange> not: I am thy fellow-servant, and <transChange>a fellow-servant</transChange> of thy brethren, that hold the testimony of Jesus. Worship God. For the Spirit of prophecy is the testimony of Jesus.
Revelation of John 19:11 And I saw heaven opened, and behold a white horse, and He that sat upon it <transChange>is</transChange> called faithful and true, and in righteousness doth He judge and make war.
Revelation of John 19:12 His eyes <transChange>are</transChange> as a flame of fire, and many crowns on his head: and He hath a name written, which none knoweth but Himself.
Revelation of John 19:13 And He <transChange>was</transChange> clothed with a vesture dipt in blood: and his name is called, "The Word of God."
Revelation of John 19:14 And the armies in heaven followed Him on white horses, clothed in fine linen white and clean.
Revelation of John 19:15 And out of his mouth goeth a sharp sword, that He may smite the nations therewith: and He shall rule them with a rod of iron: and He treadeth the wine-press of the indignation and wrath of God almighty.
Revelation of John 19:16 And He hath on his vesture and on his thigh a name written, "King of kings, and Lord of lords."
Revelation of John 19:17 And I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the fowls that fly in the midst of heaven, Come and gather yourselves together to the banquet of the great God;
Revelation of John 19:18 that ye may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of captains, and the flesh of mighty <transChange>men,</transChange> and the flesh of horses and of those that sit upon them, and the flesh of all, <transChange>both</transChange> free<transChange>men</transChange> and slaves, both small and great.
Revelation of John 19:19 And I saw the beast, and the kings of the earth, and their armies gathered together to make war with him that sitteth upon the horse, and against his army.
Revelation of John 19:20 And the beast was taken, and with him the false prophet, who had wrought signs before him, by which he deceived those who had received the mark of the beast, and those who worshipped his image. These both were cast alive into the lake of fire burning with brimstone.
Revelation of John 19:21 And the rest were slain with the sword of Him that sitteth upon the horse, <transChange>the sword</transChange> that cometh out of his mouth: and all the fowls <transChange>of heaven</transChange> were satiated with their flesh. <chapter eID="gen8158" osisID="Rev.19"/>
Revelation of John 20:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.20" sID="gen8180"/>
Revelation of John 20:1 And I saw an angel come down from heaven, who had the key of the bottomless pit, and a great chain in his hand.
Revelation of John 20:2 And he seized the dragon, that old serpent, who is the devil and satan, and bound him a thousand years,
Revelation of John 20:3 and cast him into the bottomless pit, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him, that he might deceive the nations no more, till the thousand years be finished: and then he must be loosed <transChange>for</transChange> a little time.
Revelation of John 20:4 And I saw thrones, and <transChange>persons</transChange> sat on them, and judgement was given to them: and <transChange>I saw</transChange> the souls of those who had been beheaded for the testimony of Jesus, and for the word of God; and who had not worshipped the beast, nor his image, and received not his mark upon their forehead, and on their hands; and they lived and reigned with Christ a thousand years.
Revelation of John 20:5 But the rest of the dead lived not again till the thousand years be finished.
Revelation of John 20:6 This <transChange>is</transChange> the first resurrection. Happy and holy <transChange>is</transChange> he that hath part in the first resurrection: on these the second death has no power, but they shall be priests of God and of Christ, and shall reign with Him a thousand years.
Revelation of John 20:7 And when the thousand years are ended,
Revelation of John 20:8 Satan shall be loosed from his confinement, and shall go forth to deceive the nations, that are in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them together to war, whose number <transChange>is</transChange> as the sand of the sea.
Revelation of John 20:9 And they overspread the surface of the earth, and encompassed the camp of the saints, and the beloved city: but fire came down from God out of heaven, and devoured them.
Revelation of John 20:10 And the devil, who deceived them, was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet <transChange>are,</transChange> and they shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.
Revelation of John 20:11 And I saw a great white throne, and Him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled, and no place was found for them.
Revelation of John 20:12 And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is <transChange>the book</transChange> of life: and the dead were judged by the things written in the books, according to their works.
Revelation of John 20:13 And the sea gave up the dead <transChange>that were</transChange> in it; and death and Hades gave up the dead <transChange>that were</transChange> in them: and they were judged every one according to their works.
Revelation of John 20:14 And death and Hades were cast into the lake of fire: this is the second death.
Revelation of John 20:15 And whosoever was not found written in the book of life, was cast into the lake of fire. <chapter eID="gen8180" osisID="Rev.20"/>
Revelation of John 21:0 <chapter osisID="Rev.21" sID="gen8196"/>
Revelation of John 21:1 And I saw a new heaven and a new earth; for the former heaven and the former earth passed away, and there was no more sea.
Revelation of John 21:2 And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, descending from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
Revelation of John 21:3 And I heard a great voice out of heaven, saying, Behold the tabernacle of God <transChange>is</transChange> with men, and He will dwell among them, and they shall be his people, and God himself, <transChange>even</transChange> their God, will be with them.
Revelation of John 21:4 And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; and there shall be death no more, nor sorrow, nor crying, nor any more pain: for the former <transChange>things</transChange> are passed away.
Revelation of John 21:5 And He that sat upon the throne said, Behold, I make all <transChange>things</transChange> new. And He said to me, Write: for these words are true and faithful.
Revelation of John 21:6 And He said to me, It is done. I am the Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end: I will give to him that is athirst of the fountain of the water of life freely.
Revelation of John 21:7 He that overcometh shall inherit all <transChange>things,</transChange> and I will be a God to him, and he shall be to me a son.
Revelation of John 21:8 But the fearful, and faithless, and abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars <transChange>shall have</transChange> their part in the lake that burneth with fire and brimstone; which is the second death.
Revelation of John 21:9 And there came unto me one of the seven angels, who had the seven vials full of the seven last plagues, and he spake with me, saying, Come hither, I will shew thee the bride, the Lamb's wife.
Revelation of John 21:10 And he carried me away in spirit to a great and high mountain, and he shewed me that great city, the holy Jerusalem, descending out of heaven from God, having the glory of God:
Revelation of John 21:11 and her light was like a most precious stone, <transChange>even</transChange> as a Jasper-stone resembling crystal:
Revelation of John 21:12 having also a great and high wall, with twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels; and <transChange>there were</transChange> names inscribed, which are <transChange>the names</transChange> of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel.
Revelation of John 21:13 On the east three gates; on the north three gates; on the south three gates; <transChange>and</transChange> on the west three gates.
Revelation of John 21:14 And the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
Revelation of John 21:15 And he that talked with me had a golden reed to measure the city, and it's gates, and it's wall.
Revelation of John 21:16 And the city was four-square, it's length being as much as the breadth: and he measured the city with the reed twelve thousand furlongs: the length and the breadth and the height of it are equal.
Revelation of John 21:17 And he measured the wall of it an hundred forty four cubits according to the measure of a man, for such was <transChange>that</transChange> of the angel.
Revelation of John 21:18 And the structure of its wall was <transChange>of</transChange> Jasper, and the city pure gold, like transparent glass.
Revelation of John 21:19 And the foundations of the wall of the city <transChange>were</transChange> set off each with precious stones: the first foundation a jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony,
Revelation of John 21:20 the fourth an emerald, the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprasus, the eleventh jacinth, the twelfth an amethyst.
Revelation of John 21:21 And the twelve gates were twelve pearls; each of the gates was of one pearl: and the street of the city was pure gold like resplendent glass.
Revelation of John 21:22 And I saw no temple in it: for the Lord God almighty, and the Lamb, are the temple of it.
Revelation of John 21:23 And the city hath no need of the sun, nor of the moon, to shine in it: for the glory of God enlighteneth it, and the Lamb <transChange>is</transChange> it's light.
Revelation of John 21:24 And the nations of those that are saved shall walk in the light of it: and the kings of the earth bring their glory and <transChange>their</transChange> honor into it.
Revelation of John 21:25 And the gates of it are not to be shut by day: for there shall be no night there.
Revelation of John 21:26 And they shall bring the glory and honor of the nations into it.
Revelation of John 21:27 And nothing shall enter into it that defileth, and practiseth abomination and falshood: but those only who are written in the Lamb's book of life. <chapter eID="gen8196" osisID="Rev.21"/>

And the leaves of the tree <transChange>are</transChange> for the healing of the nations.
Revelation of John 22:3 And every curse shall cease: and the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it, and his servants shall serve Him.
Revelation of John 22:4 And they shall see his face; and his name shall be on their foreheads.
Revelation of John 22:5 And there shall be no night there: and they have no need of a candle, nor of the light of the sun; for the Lord God giveth them light; and they shall reign for ever and ever.
Revelation of John 22:6 And he said unto me, These words are faithful and true: and the Lord God of the holy prophets hath sent his angel to shew unto his servants what must soon be.

Revelation of John 22:10 And he said unto me, Seal not the words of the prophecy of this book; for the time is near.
Revelation of John 22:11 Let him, that is unjust, be unjust still: and let him, that is filthy, be filthy still: and let him, that is righteous, be righteous still; and let him, that is holy, be holy still.
